story:
In Short

We’ve taken a 161,259 word long, 118 year old gothic novel, thrown it at 5 young actors, and asked them to bring it to life in 90 minutes.

The result is a hilarious, original, edge of your seat comic horror play that portrays Bram Stoker’s Dracula like you’ve never seen him before.

...or at least it will be, if we can cover our budget on time!

And that’s where we need your help...


What We Need and Why

Putting on a theatre production, even in Sri Lanka, is a pretty expensive affair.

Our play goes on the boards at the Lionel Wendt Theatre, Colombo, from 10th to 12th July 2015. The script is written, the set and props have been ordered, the costumes are being made and the actors are really getting into character.

We  need about US$ 7,000 more to pay for practice spaces for rehearsals, and for publicity, lights, sounds, costumes, make up, and blood… lots and lots of blood…

With your support, we can make Dracula! truly spooktacular, chillarious and fangtastic.

And as AnandaDrama is a non profit organisation that fosters the English language skills of students through theatre, your support will help us continue to enrich the lives of hundreds of youngsters in the future.


What You Can Do

Donate!

Spread the word so that others can donate too!

And, if you're in Colombo between 10th and 12th July, come see our show!


More About The Play

Dracula! is an original adaptation of Bram Stoker's novel, written by Nishantha de Silva, Rajitha Hettiarachchi and Ishtartha Wellaboda, and directed by Thushara Hettihamu together with the writers.

The play features up and coming Sri Lankan thespians Dinoo Wickramage, Vishan Gunawardena, Eraj Gunewardana, Charith Dissanayake and Nandun Dissanayake. 

These five young actors will juggle close to 50 different roles between them in nimble, high octane and thoroughly entertaining comic performances. Dracula! will also feature an original musical score composed by Ranil Goonewardena.


More About Us

AnandaDrama is a theatre company built around the past and present students of Ananda College, Colombo. Our aim is to stage enjoyable and intriguing plays whilst helping students learn English through theatre.

While AnandaDrama's primary educational focus remains on the students at Ananda, we have recently started fostering an interest in theatre amongst students at other schools as well. A special subsidized school show of Dracula! will be held on 10th July in front of more than 500 high school students from around Sri Lanka.

Dracula! is not a one off, but part of a continuing tradition. Our past productions include the award winning original political satire Alles in Wonderland, a lyrical production of Michael Morpurgo’s Kensuke’s Kingdom, and the critically and popularly acclaimed bilingual devised play we created in collaboration with Stages Theatre Group, Grease Yaka.

We are passionate about helping students achieve their true potential through the arts. Since 2006, hundreds of students have participated in our English and Theatre workshops, and 136 students have acted in our plays to date. They have gone on to achieve great success in their studies as well as in their chosen fields. 

More information about us is available at www.anandadrama.org, and we can be contacted at any time on info@anandadrama.org.

Thank you for your support!

story:
WHAT’S FORRÓ ROMA

FORRO ROMA is an active community involved in the diffusion of a popular Brazilian culture, in particular Forró, a traditional music genre and a very popular  couple dance. The FORRO ROMA project was started in 2012 and this October 2015 it will present the 3rd edition of the International Forró, Festival that will take place in Rome from October 16th to 18 th. 

THE FESTIVAL

The Festival provides 2 days of workshops with forró, and samba teachers and 3 nights of live music and DJ sets with musicians from Brazil and other European cities. The Festival will take place in different locations, the workshops will be held in a dance centre, and the shows, as every year, will be hosted in 3 different places located in the San Lorenzo neighborhood.

WHY THE CROWDFUNDING CAMPAIGN

The crowdfunding campaign is your contribution to the realization of the Festival and replaces the payment of the Festival tickets.

The funds raised will be used to cover part of the costs, the travel expenses , hospitality expenses and payment cachet of musicians and teachers, and the cost of the venues.

At the end of the fundraising you will find all the informations and the detailed program of the Festival on our website! All that will be achieved, will be thanks to your help!

CROWDFUNDING GOAL

Our goal is 9000 € to cover the basic costs. The more funds we raise the more we can offer as a festival, it means more lessons,  bands and  services !

HOW YOU CAN HELP and YOU GET IN GEAR

With your contribution you'll make it possible. You can  get a Full Pass for the Festival which includes two days of workshops and 3 nights of shows or a Night pass that includes 3 nights of shows. You can also just support the project Roma Forró, Festival with a smaller contribution!

OUR WAYS OF SAYING THANK YOU

We will try to make a wonderful unforgettable festival with great musicians and teachers!

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

SHARE

Spreading the word, spreading the project, through Facebook emails and other social networks is just another valuable way you can help us!

QUESTIONS

·  At the end of the campaign can I still buy tickets for the festival?

Yes, you can buy the tickets starting from the first day of the festival at higher prices. All the information will be on the site forroroma.it 

if you need more informations you can write to info@forroroma.it

·  Can I buy a ticket for one evening or for a single day?

Yes, it will be possible starting from the first day of the festival.

story:
Dance is universal.
Sadly, access to world-class dance training is not.

River North Dance Chicago is committed to erasing barriers to critical development by establishing a needs-based scholarship program for young dancers to attend the 2015 Summer Training Workshops.

$15,000 in 28 days. Make dance dreams come true.
Reach back to propel them forward. Raise up the next generation.
#RivNoReachBackRaiseUp


The Problem and the Solution

Many talented, aspiring dancers live in areas where in-depth, focused training is not available. Or if access exists, the cost is prohibitive. Together, we can provide the solution. With your financial support and River North’s professional-level training, we can reach back and raise up kids with needs-based scholarships for dancers from rural and urban backgrounds. Scholarships are available to dancers age 11+ who have shown dedication, respect and motivation but are unable to afford the costly tuition and housing necessary to continue their creative education and artistic empowerment.



River North Dance Chicago's Training Programs are Unique

Dancers reach their fullest potential through individualized instruction in a challenging — yet fun — environment, offering an immersive experience in technique, style and professional development. An international training destination, River North hosts young dancers from as far away as Spain, Japan and Israel.


Our multi-dimensional Summer Workshops offer a 360° dance education, including:

  • Unparalleled access to current and former River North dancers and artistic staff


  • Seminar series covering nutrition, audition processes, the business of dance, theater etiquette and offstage career preparation

  • College guidance and preparation sessions with a counselor specializing in the performing arts

  • Sessions with physical therapists to better understand personal anatomy and injury prevention

  • Professional mentorship throughout the duration of the program



#RivNoReachBackRaiseUp Significantly Impacts Young Dancers

Your gift will have an immediate and meaningful impact on kids who need help, providing not only world-class dance technique, but also teaching confidence, collaboration, and adaptive skills — traits to last a lifetime. 100% of proceeds will fund workshop tuition, chaperoned housing, and healthy meals for young dancers with a dream. Contributions today provide the following:

  • Tuition for the 2015 Summer Workshops, ranging $550-$950

  • Housing and two meals per day, ranging $650-$1,690

  • Critical performance experience by dancing at the Summer Student Showcase

  • Ticket for the student to attend an inspiring River North Dance Chicago performance

The final number of scholarships allocated will depend on the percentage of applicants who will require housing. If we exceed the $15,000 goal, additional funds will allow us to extend scholarships to even MORE kids, as well as help establish yearlong needs-based scholarships, allowing a wider and deeper impact.


Pave the Path of Young Aspiring Dancers

Dancers + artists: You know how critical your training in a supportive environment has been on your journey to become an artist. Launch the next generation!

Parents: You know how important a child’s dreams and passions are. Invest in another’s dream!

Arts + education advocated: You have a hand in developing and inspiring kids to pave their future path. Transform a life!


Reach into your pocket to raise up a kid.

Support this project with a gift of any amount. 

Share on Facebook, Twitter + other networks.


Dancers applying for a needs-based scholarship: click here to submit application before June 10.

story:
The 3MT home of the Manchester Shakespeare Company is a newly formed theatre company enjoying success. But for that success to continue, we have to find ways of raising more funds to enable us to pay all who work with MSC on the productions. The power ballad in the video was written by John Topliff and Gina Frost for our previous production, 12 Nights, and it is sung by Sophie Anne Elicott, one of our leading ladies. The 2nd video is of the 3MT Venue, Manchester Shakespeare's home. The following link is to a review of 12 Nights. Thank you. 

http://www.britishtheatreguide.info/reviews/12-nights-3mt-11016
We are passionate about working in Manchester in this theatre with the wonderful Manchester Shakespeare Company actors we love working with. We submitted a bid for the next performance, Summer Dreaming, a musical theatre comedy written by John Topliff.  An adaptation based on Shakespeare's classic, A Midsummer Night's Dream. 

Considerable in-kind to instill confidence in the Arts Council was included in the financial breakdown of the bid but it's clear, applying for funding is becoming more difficult. Unfortunately, the bid was unsuccessful they: "preferred another project".

The theatre is a full  specification theatre and venue ideal for theatre development; it is a 60 seater recycled theatre and is run by two retired teachers and performers But the wrong side of 50 to target employment. 

As a small development space, which historically survived on booking fees, it needs funds to assist with paying actors and practitioners involved in the process of generating first class entertainment for the Manchester and North West audience. The profits, if any, rarely stretch to covering fees, including the fees of the directors who are responsible for Manchester Shakespeare Company and the running of the theatre. 

This new concept, as an alternative to applying to the Arts Council England, can work if the MSC actors, who are often multi talented, can put on an excellent cabaret night where door proceeds, raffle proceeds and pay-to-sing Karaoke, contribute to fees. It's unlikely, the evening will generate enough. That is why MSC and the MSC actors are willing to do what is needed to generate the extra funding required to secure income. 

The success of this campaign and the cabaret evening could be a new way to raise funds-for-fees. 

What We Need & What You Get


  • Membership of Manchester Shakespeare Company is available on their website: www.manchestershakespearecompany.co.uk and the perks are tickets and thank yous in return for donations. A sponsor package will be offered to businesses interested in making larger donations: for example a 'Pearl and Dean' style advertising package is available.
  • The funds will still go to funds-for-fees if the funds raised exceed the target amount!
  • The cabaret evening is expected to generate £600. The Indiegogo will hopefully generate £500 to help reach £900 to £1100 target which we had in mind. Sophie and Sophie, two first class actors and performers will  fairly distribute the funds between the actors and practitioners.
  • The extra Perk of £250 is targeted at independent businesses. Thank you.
  •  All actors are responsible for their personal tax and national insurance contributions and will declare income to the Inland Revenue. 

The Impact

  • Manchester Shakespeare Company provides work and training for actors and non actors. The uniqueness of the theatre company is in the context of each adaptation which involves Manchester, Manchester people, North West cultural, historical and political climates during the industrial and modern history of Manchester and the North West. 
  • Risks & Challenge
  • Manchester Shakespeare Company is determined to offer its customers entertainment and support educational understanding of Shakespeare's classics. Without funding, this is not always possible. To date, the projects have been funded by the directors of the company but this is not sustainable. So we're reaching out to the general public who desire this idea and support literature and the classics.  

As academics, we are able to continue to share these qualities with fun and music!

Other Ways You Can Help

We are always looking for wonderful people who love the arts and are passionate about British history, literature and the classics, such as Shakespeare.

story:
Welcome to Caroline Nesbitt’s Contra Dance campaign! The goal: to raise $10,000 toward the world premiere of my play, Contra Dance, to be presented at the historic Barnstormers Theatre in Tamworth, New Hampshire, September 3-6.

In a contra dance, every person changes partners and perspectives as they go through the patterns and music of the dance, like a kaleidoscope that changes every time you turn it. But in the end, you always end up ‘home with your own’.

So that’s the story of Contra Dance: our lives change, time bends us, our hearts break, our towns fill up with people we don’t recognize. Sometimes we get lost. Sometimes we lose hope. But there’s a pattern to the dance, and if we’re lucky, it always brings us home.

I’ve been a published writer and a working actor for over 40 years, and if there’s one thing I’ve learned in that time, it’s that if you want to do the work you want... and work with your friends... you often have to create your own. So In 1998 I founded Advice To The Players, an educational Shakespeare company that’s still going strong, and has given a whole lot of actors a whole lot of good work.

And now, there’s Contra Dance.

I believe women need a larger voice in theatre, both as writers and as actors. I believe talented older actors need more of a voice in theatre, and more good roles to chew on. So Contra Dance has 6 ornery characters over the age of 55, 4 of them smart, tough, funny women.

Contra Dance’s characters work, live, curse, drink, have sex, and, well, you now... generally act like younger people. Only with wrinkles.

Contra Dance has been nearly ten years in the making. It’s been workshopped, rewritten, read out loud, rewritten some more, read again, and tweaked. In April its first public staged reading at New Hampshire Theatre Project’s Intelligent Theatre Festival in Portsmouth, New Hampshire was a big success. Here’s what Genevieve Aichele, Director of NHTP, says about Contra Dance:

“What really impressed me about the script is that it creates character, relationship and atmosphere through witty, authentic and intelligent dialogue.  It's the kind of play that doesn't get written much anymore - no magic realism, no special effects, no cutaway scenes that belong in a film screenplay - just plain old-fashioned excellent dialogue.  I also like the focus on older women and men characters who are so often ignored in contemporary work.”

So Contra Dance is ready to roll! 

$10,000 won’t be all the money we need - the entire budget is around $17,000 - but it will be enough to pay the actors - because I don’t think professionals should work for free. 

Risk? Of course there's risk, theatre is all about risk! But one thing I guarantee: This show will go on, and with your help, it will soar.

We have a whole bunch of cool perks for donors, so please check them out! And if you’re cash poor, want to help, and live in New Hampshire, you can volunteer to be a part of the Contra Dance staff. We can always use help from box office to ushers to stage hands to marketing to putting up posters.

We'll be keeping you posted with updates and video clips, so be sure to check back often.

We start rehearsals August 24, and play September 3-6. Come join us for the World Premiere of Contra Dance at The Barnstormers Theatre in Tamworth, New Hampshire!

And thanks so much for your participation.

We start rehearsals August 24, and play September 3-6. Come join
us for the World Premiere of Contra Dance
at The Barnstormers Theatre in Tamworth, New Hampshire! 
And thanks so much for your participation.

story:
Hi, I’m Steve McMahon, a Scottish actor and writer of sad indie love song. Produced by The Dionysian, with a team of talented artists, sad indie love song will be performed as part of The International Fridge Festival this summer at IRT in New York City. sad indie love song is an offbeat non-linear love story set in NYC, that asks important questions in a visual, physical and exciting way. With your help, we can make this playful urban love story a reality.


What we need and what you get

Producing theater in New York, even a short play like this, and with the assistance of being a part of Fridge Fest, is expensive. Absolutely anything you can give, no matter how big or small, helps immensely in bringing this play in front of an audience, and we would greatly appreciate your support.

You donation will give us a place to rehearse, acknowledge our team for their work, help with the subsidized production costs associated with being a part of Fridge Fest, and help us get the word out about this great play. We have put together some great perks - from signed postcards, to social media shoutouts, prize bundles of The Dionysian, and even a one-off perk of afternoon tea for two at Tea and Sympathy in Greenwich Village - to say thank you for joining us on this exciting journey.


The Impact

Your support will allow us to bring sad indie love song to audiences in New York, and for the play to receive its world premiere as part of the New York International Fridge Festival this summer. Your support will allow us to provoke, explore and question with this physical, visual, skewed, New York City love story.

The New York Fridge Festival is in its first year, and focuses on unique thought-provoking works from both established and emerging playwrights, all of which feature a fridge. There are 10 plays from established, commissioned playwrights and 5 plays from newer writers via open submission, one of which is sad indie love song. We were delighted to be invited to take part in this new Festival.

The Fridge Festival is doing food drives, and offering free tickets for those who bring food to their ‘fill our fridge’ nights, which will then be delivered to food banks local to the theater. It’s a great group of people to work with, and we are excited to be a part of it.


Who we are

Steve McMahon - Playwright
Steve McMahon is an award-winning Scottish actor and writer based in Brooklyn. His plays have been developed and produced at IRT Theater, Origin Theatre Company, Fundamental Theater Project, Nylon Fusion, The Arctic Group, Between Us Productions and Big Apple Theater Festival in NYC and the Traverse Theatre, Village Pub Theatre, Bite-Size Plays, Strangetown and Ineffect in Scotland, including at the Edinburgh Fringe Festival. He has been published by Smith & Kraus and The Dionysian. He is a member of the Dramatists Guild of America and co-founder and editor of the playwriting magazine, The Dionysian.

As an actor, he graduated from the American Academy of Dramatic Arts, where he won the Lawrence Langner Award for Voice & Speech and has performed Shakespeare, 20th century classics, new plays and children's theatre.

Benjamin Viertel - Director
Benjamin is a freelance director based in New York City, born in France and raised in South Florida by German and Italian parents. Upcoming: GRINDR THE MUSICAL (UK and Italian tour). Past: THE BITTER TEARS OF PETRA VON KANT (New Ohio Theater), FIREFACE (The Brick), CLIPPED (Atlantic Stage II), KRAGTAR: A MONSTER MUSICAL (Peoples Improv Theater), SAD INDIE LOVE SONG (IRT Theater), CRIMES OF THE HEART and AVENUE Q (Bristol Valley Theater); and award-winning webseries [BLANK] MY LIFE. Benjamin has worked with BAM, Roundabout Theater Company, Huntington Theater Company, The New Group, and The Civilians. Member of Kennedy Center Director’s Lab, MTC’s Directing Fellow, The Civilian’s R&D Group, and Resident Artist at The Brick and Abrons Arts Center. Co-founder and Artistic Director of Third Space. Education: Carnegie Mellon University. www.benjaminviertel.com

Paul Hudson - Lighting Designer
Paul Hudson (Lighting Designer): Is thrilled to be joining the team on Sad Indie Love Song and return for his second production at IRT (previously: Novacation).  Recent - Lucky Stiff (BVT), Henry V and Cymbeline (Juilliard Drama Division), Cracked Orlando (Juilliard CIA), The Cheesemonger's Invitational, Sorry (Shook Ones).  Upcoming: Lonely Planet (Keen Co.), Affections of an Alleycat and Call it Clover (New Brooklyn Theater), eVirtuosos (Juilliard CIA).

The Dionysian
The Dionysian is an international playwriting magazine, that aims to highlight emerging and established playwrights of all genres and backgrounds through a quarterly publication and online content. http://www.dionysianmagazine.com/

Natalie Donahue McMahon - Actor 
Natalie Donahue graduated from the American Academy of Dramatic Arts in 2015 and performed as a member of their Company program through 2016. She most recently was seen in Random Access Theatre's season 'Resistance and Rebellion in Rep' playing Ismene in a new adaptation of Antigone. She also had the fortune of performing in one of Steve McMahon's other works, Settling in a reading at Origin Theatre Company's Annual Cultural Symposium. Love and thanks to Steve and the Dionysian. www.nataliedonahue.net

Declan Maloney Drummond - Actor
Declan has acted in Burying Your Brother In The Pavement (National Theatre Youth Connections) and Off-Off Broadway production of Ashes To Ashes (Invisible Girl Theatre Co.). He is also the Editor-In-Chief of The Dionysian literary magazine.

Shawna Wigney - Actor
Originally from Canada and the Cayman Islands, Shawna is a graduate of the two-year conservatory and company program at The American Academy of Dramatic Arts. As well as a performer, she is a co-founder and editor of NY-based literary journal, The Dionysian.

Lianne Kennedy - Producer
Lianne is a Scottish NYC-based theater marketer, administrator and producer, and currently works as Director of Marketing at the New York Musical Festival. Prior to moving to the USA, Lianne was Production Administrator at the Royal Lyceum Theatre Company, and worked as Producer of Sanitise, a Fringe First Award-winning physical theater piece by Melanie Jordan and Caitlin Skinner during the Edinburgh Fringe Festival in 2014 and subsequent Scottish tour. In NYC, Lianne recently produced The Dudleys! A Family Game (NYC Premiere, HERE) in October 2016.


Other ways you can help

  • Share this campaign using the Indiegogo share tools below
  • Spread the word
  • Come see Sad Indie Love Song at the New York International Fridge Festival
  • Bring food for one of the Fill Our Fridge nights and enjoy great new work, while also supporting those in need in the city
  • Check out The Dionysian’s website
  • Follow The Dionysian on Facebook and Twitter
  • Follow Sad Indie Love Song on Facebook


Thank you so much in advance! We can’t wait to see you there!

story:
A WESTSIDE STORY

This is a docudrama stageplay, based on true events that occurred in Tucson, AZ. The play is about the historic people-powered movement that sprouted up from the westside Tucson barrios, in the 1960s and '70s. 

 

BACKGROUND

For decades, the City of Tucson thoroughly neglected its westside, Mexican American barrios. Taxpaying residents on the westside had to deal with unpaved streets and sidewalks, very few street lights, and a lack of basic services and facilities, including recreational spaces for children. Barrio children had to play in the street and empty lots or were forced to go to other neighborhoods to swim or play in a park.

In 1967, politicians campaigning in the barrios promised to build a park and neighborhood center on the west side if they won. After the newly-elected Mayor and Council reneged on their promise, barrio residents, propelled by the energy of the Chicano Movement, organized the El Rio Coalition to stand up for the barrios and demand that the City keep its promise. The “El Rio for the People” movement revolved around the El Rio Golf Course, a former members-only country club, which the City had bought and converted to a municipal golf course. Located between barrios Hollywood and El Rio/Sovaco, the lush, green golf course was a harsh contrast to the dusty streets and empty lots the barrio children had to play in.

The fight was not an easy one. Over many months, entire families marched and picketed in the summer heat and driving rain and confronted powerful elected officials. They faced racism, police brutality, and many other obstacles. Many El Rio Coalition members were arrested. Furthermore, they made many personal sacrifices for the greater cause. A number of El Rio Coalition members dropped out of college in order to focus on organizing full-time.

Eventually, the El Rio Coalition won an historic victory, securing a park and neighborhood center for the westside. The 1970 El Rio for the People movement was a defining moment in the political evolution of the westside. That historic movement started a domino effect across the city and inspired other neighborhoods to also stand up to City Hall and demand equality.

This play tells this powerful and important story!

 

TELLING OUR STORIES

As a community, it is vital that we tell our own stories.

Art and storytelling have always been vital to our community. With that said, we cannot wait for others to tell our community's stories; we must do it ourselves! Your support will make this happen!

 

WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

We are seeking to raise $10,000 in order to produce this play. Here is the list of where the funds will go to:

Rental fees, wardrobe cost, props, actor/actress compensation, and the production of a professionally-designed program!

Your contributions will make this play a reality! Any amount helps!

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you can't contribute, you can still help!

Please get the word out by sharing this page with your friends on social media and email!

Make it easy for yourself and use the share tools on the left side of the page! 

 

ABOUT US

Sal Baldenegro - Writer/Director

Sal was born and raised in Tucson, and grew up on the westside. He attended TUSD public schools, including Tucson High Magnet School. From there, he received his B.A. degree in Media Arts from the University of Arizona's School of Theatre, Film and Television, in 2006.

Sal has been very involved in a number of social issues, and he is currently making a docudrama feature film, "Sacred Goals", based on the true story of the fight to defend ethnic studies in Tucson schools. Sal grew up hearing the story of the El Rio for the People Movement from his father, Salomón R. Baldenegro, a longtime Chicano organizer, and one of the original leaders of the El Rio Coalition.

 

Miguel Ortega - Producer/Actor

With over 20 years of leadership in non-profit, business, and electoral political communications, Miguel continues to be one of westside Tucson’s leading advocates. Miguel is also a trained actor and director for the stage and film. He earned a B.A. degree in Theater Production from the University of Arizona in 1991.

Miguel has worked on a number of independent and professional films and plays, and he has appeared in several films on the USA Network, and on stage at the Arizona Theater Company. Over the years, Miguel has served as the master of ceremonies for several Tucson events, including Barrio Hollywood's annual Fiesta Grande.

story:
As the creator and producer of “Voci Dance: Paint Chips,” it has been a pleasure to marry the poetry of word-jazz master Ken Nordine with the movements of our clever and creative professional dancers. The result has been magic, and our audiences and the critics are raving.

This production marked the 15-year anniversary of Voci Dance, the first contemporary dance company to perform at the Orlando Fringe. We have been there since the beginning. And we were deemed the "Best and the Brightest Colors" by the Orlando Weekly, which also published a rave review by editor Jessica Bryce Young. The Orlando Sentinel also declared it the "Best of the Fest," after giving it an enthusiastic thumbs-up in its review.

Now we have the chance to take this winning piece of dance theater to The Indianapolis Fringe Festival in August, and we are eager to make the jump to take this production to new audiences.

But we need your financial help to get there. Any amount is appreciated. 

As our two additional productions at the Orange Studio proved, there are many possibilities for adapting this crowd-pleasing production. Our successful afternoon family show featured art activities and our evening show DJ Nigel at the turntables created a warehouse lounge vibe. We have hopes of continuing to tour and adapt this production and have already done special educational outreaches at local schools and are working on curriculum that will be available on our website. Education remains a big part of the Voci Dance, which is a registered 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization.

Throughout, we have appreciated your encouragement and positive feedback. All of our productions to date were orchestrated on a shoestring budget. This time around, we want to be able to pay our dancers and crew appropriately, and perform our professional best at IndyFringe. We take our job as ambassadors of Orlando Arts very seriously. We promise to represent our home town in colorful style.

Donate any amount, and your name will be added to the Voci Dance Virtual Hall of Fame with our heartfelt thanks. With a gift of $25 or more, you will receive a collectible Voci Dance: Paint Chips Sticker designed by Lure Design. Donate $100 or more and receive a  Voci Dance: Paint Chips T-shirt designed by Lure Design. Donate $250 more and you and a guest will be our special guests at a private in-studio performance this fall.

And if you're in Indianapolis from Aug. 16 through 27th, please visit us at the IndyFringe Festival. Tell your friends and family! You can find our show schedule on our Voci Dance website.

Here’s our travel budget:

Voci Dance: Paint Chips Goes to IndyFringe                                      Proposed Budget

Flights ($200 x 5 dancers, 1 choreographer, 1 manager, 1 tech)      1,600.00 

Per diem 4 days ($25 day x 8)                                                                          800.00 

Theater rental                                                                                                         350.00 

Insurance                                                                                                                  100.00 

Rental car (2 cars, $115 x 2)                                                                               230.00 

Posters & postcards, printed (color)                                                              400.00 

Show programs, printed (color)                                                                       200.00 

Incidentals                                                                                                                500.00 

Marketing/ Social Media/PR (Lindy Shepherd)                                         250.00 

Graphics (Lure Design)                                                                                        250.00 

Dancer Pay ($225 x 5 dancers)                                                                       1,125.00 

SM Tech Pay                                                                                                             220.00 

Costumes                                                                                                                  250.00 

Photography                                                                                                             100.00 

Choregrapher                                                                                                           225.00 

Production Manager                                                                                              500.00 

Projections (Dana Mott)                                                                                       150.00 

Music Fees/ BMI                                                                                                     100.00 

Lighting Design                                                                                                        150.00

Indiegogo platform fees (5% of $7,500)                                                        375.00
______________________________________________________________________

TOTAL                                                                                                   $7,875.00

story:
COPPELIA THEATRE e HORROR VACUI project         

Cari Amici, sono passati quasi cinque anni da quando abbiamo avviato la nostra attività: partite nel 2010 con la fondazione di una piccola compagnia di Teatro di Animazione, la COPPELIA THEATRE, siamo giunte a realizzare un’impresa culturale indipendente, la HORROR VACUI project, inaugurando, nel marzo 2015,  un centro sperimentale di cinema e teatro di animazione dotato di un laboratorio artistico-multimediale, con sede in una suggestiva torre di avvistamento medioevale, nel borgo termale di San Casciano dei Bagni, tra gli incanti senesi.  Il centro HORROR VACUI project si configura come un unicum su territorio nazionale, capace di far respirare a chi lo frequenta la stessa aria delle grandi capitali europee, offrendo al pubblico le proprie competenze e promuovendo l’arte e i media come strumenti creativi, educativi e di comunicazione.  HORROR VACUI project è inoltre ideatore e capofila del progetto di rete Araneum Artis, una ragnatela di centri specializzati in arti sceniche in stretto dialogo tra loro; un sistema proteiforme di residenze artistiche e cantieri teatrali che offrono la loro professionalità su territorio nazionale grazie a una rete di centri che si estende dalla Toscana alla Sardegna, dal Lazio alla Campania, rivolti all’alta formazione professionale nei campi del teatro, del cinema e dell’animazione.  Ma HORROR VACUI project è anche un sito culturale e una comunità composta dagli artisti e da voi, un pubblico trasversale per età, passioni e identità, un impegno che ci prendiamo ogni giorno con ognuno di voi, perché crediamo profondamente che arte e cultura siano da annoverarsi tra i bisogni primari dell’essere umano. Da oggi vogliamo intraprendere una nuova sfida, la realizzazione della nuova produzione teatrale il Barbablù di Georg Trakl, dramma espressionista per marionette e attori, nella versione di Marco Cavicchioli.  Per questo ti chiediamo: sostienici! Passa da semplice spettatore a coproduttore!

La nostra campagna: BARBABLU', dramma surrealista per marionette e attori

Nel Maggio 2016, COPPELIA THEATRE debutterà al Teatro Verdi di Milano in occasione dell'IF- Festival Internazionale del Teatro di Figura, con il suo Barbablù, regia di Marco Cavicchioli, spettacolo multimediale di marionette e attori, ispirato alla famosa fiaba trascritta da Charles Perrault nel XVII secolo, nella versione del poeta austriaco Georg Trakl (1887- 1914), una delle voci più drammatiche e vive della letteratura del Novecento.

Nella logica della compagnia e nell’evidenza della credibilità maturata, sono coinvolti nel progetto artisti italiani di fama internazionale, come Marco Cavicchioli attore e regista, che nella sua ricca carriera ha lavorato con nomi del calibro di Arnaldo Picchi, Jerzy Stuhr, Leo De Berardonis, Raul Ruiz, Claudio Morganti, Cesare Ronconi,  Luciano Nattino, Gerald Thomas, Giampiero Solari, Giorgio Gallione, Gabriele Lavia, Mario Martone, Andrea de Rosa, Alessandro Gassmann. O ancora il talentuosissimo Stefano Bechini che si occuperà della colonna sonora dello spettacolo, produttore, compositore e musicista,  sound e multimedia designer, attivo in territori musicali che spaziano dall’elettronica sperimentale alla classica. Ha lavorato con grandi artisti come: Paolo Fresu, Enrico Pieranunzi, Luis Enriquez Bacalov, Larry Grenadier, Danilo Rea, dirigendo inoltre progetti artistici per il Ministero dei Beni Culturali. Ad occuparsi del design delle scenografie e dei personaggi sarà invece Stefano Tambellini, illustratore, animatore e filmmaker, laureato in animazione tradizionale presso il Centro Sperimentale di Cinematografia di Torino, dove ha seguito workshops tenuti dal maestro inglese della stop-motion Barry Purves.

Il Barbablù di e con Marco Cavicchioli, uno spettacolo romantico e tragico, in cui un attore e una marionetta rispondono alla provocazione lanciata, più di cento anni fa, da Edward Gordon Craig nel suo articolo L’attore e la Supermarionetta, in cui veniva teorizzata la necessità di estromettere gli attori dal teatro. E proprio di “supermarionette” si tratta, le marionette da polso, tecnica unica al mondo, inventata dall’ingegnere robotico siberiano Vladimir Zakharov, e di cui la COPPELIA THEATRE custodisce i segreti costruttivi. 

Una produzione teatrale multimediale che farà immergere il pubblico in un mondo misterioso, gotico e notturno: musiche originali, videomapping e animazioni proiettate su grande schermo, insieme ad altri sorprendenti trucchi di scena, creeranno uno spettacolo poetico, un'opera al confine tra cinema e teatro.

L'unicità della COPPELIA THEATRE e di HORROR VACUI project        

L’intera storia della COPPELIA THEATRE e di HORROR VACUI project parla non solo di teatro, di cinema e di spettacolo, ma anche di arte e antiche tradizioni coniugate alla più moderna tecnologia. Tutti i nostri pupazzi sono scolpiti nel legno e dipinti a mano. I tempi di costruzione sono molto lunghi a causa dell’estrema complessità tecnica. Per costruire una marionetta sono necessari tre mesi e ancor più tempo è necessario per la calibrazione dei fili e per l’apprendimento della manipolazione. Tecnica unica al mondo in cui la robotica viene applicata al teatro d’animazione. Ed è proprio l’amore per i meccanismi complessi che contribuisce a creare quella fusione tra tecnologia e poesia che è da sempre uno degli intenti del nostro fare.

Per raggiungere i loro obiettivi la COPPELIA THEATRE e HORROR VACUI project vorrebbero raccogliere  7.000 euro 

Il progetto è nella sua fase iniziale, è stato concluso il lavoro sul testo e sono già stati realizzati i bozzetti delle marionette e delle scenografie. Non avendo ricevuto alcun finanziamento pubblico, chiediamo gentilmente il tuo aiuto per raccogliere i fondi necessari per ultimare il progetto: regia, marionette, musiche originali,  scenografie, costumi e strumentazione tecnica. Speriamo di raccogliere € 7.000.

Nel caso non raggiungessimo il nostro goal, i fondi raccolti saranno comunque investiti nel progetto. Innanzitutto per la regia, in modo che il lavoro drammaturgico possa cominciare. Se la cifra raggiunta lo permetterà procederemo poi con i pupazzi, le scenografie e le musiche originali.

Informazioni consegna ricompense      

Il gruppo promotore offrirà ai donatori una serie di premi:

  • cartoline, manifesti, magliette, ecc. La shopper di COPPELIA THEATRE e HORROR VACUI project sarà consegnata per posta a Settembre 2015;
  • un accesso al canale vimeo del progetto, dove posteremo materiale dietro le quinte e anteprime del progetto;
  • il tuo nome nei credits dello spettacolo come coproduttore;
  • una copia digitale del progetto o un dvd spedito ovunque nel mondo;
  • la fotografia, tiratura limitata, del fotografo Mauro Sini, sarà consegnata per posta a Settembre 2015;
  • posti in prima fila in occasione della prima nazionale al Teatro Verdi di Milano; i biglietti per il teatro e il festival si ritireranno direttamente in loco. Il donatore verrà contattato dalla segreteria di HORROR VACUI project per concordare la data;
  • 1 replica del Barbablù,  per le donazioni superiori a € 1.000;
  • una marionetta realizzata a mano in esemplare unico per collezionisti (3 mesi di costruzione), per donazioni pari a € 7.000.

L’impatto di Barbablù sulla cultura contemporanea                    

Barbablù, dramma espressionista per marionette e attori, tratto dall’omonimo Puppen­spiel di Georg Trakl, è un progetto di spettacolo innovativo, un’opera dalla rara forza poetica che unisce il linguaggio teatrale a quello cinematografico, le tradizionali tecniche costruttive di pupazzi alla più moderna tecnologia biorobotica. La riduzione al minimo dello sviluppo scenico, determina una concentrazione dei valori drammatici nella densità visionaria del linguaggio, un delirio lucido che è di per sé scena, personaggio e dramma in una continua tensione tra ethos e pathos, tra Cosmos e Caos. Nell’attenta riscrittura fatta dal regista e attore Marco Cavicchioli, i frequenti ricorsi al simbolismo  si uniscono ad un verso elementare che dà all'opera una specie di perversità derivante dalla sfasatura tra ingenuità dei mezzi espressivi e densità mistica dei significati poetici.Una messa in scena unica nel suo genere dove il pubblico viene accolto direttamente sul palcoscenico insieme agli attori, e che offre allo spettatore un’esperienza estetica esclusiva, una speciale partecipazione allo svolgimento del dramma, un punto di vista interno seppur nascosto, uno spiare ed insieme un assistere all'inesorabile succedersi degli accadimenti. 

Precedenti progetti realizzati con successo                                                  

Abbiamo in passato già realizzato con successo uno spettacolo di sole marionette per un pubblico di adulti, Clockwork Metaphysics, il risultato finale di quattro intensi anni di ricerca sviluppatasi su differenti livelli: costruttivo, drammaturgico, musicale; una ricerca che si è avvalsa della preziosa collaborazione di svariati professionisti. Un primo studio, col titolo Due destini, è stato presentato dalla compagnia in prima nazionale al Teatro Verdi di Milano, lo scorso Ottobre, in apertura dell’IF, Festival Internazionale del Teatro di Figura, riscuotendo calorosi consensi da parte della critica e del pubblico. Da quello studio iniziale, attraverso una paziente e calibrata  distillazione, la COPPELIA THEATRE è finalmente giunta a realizzare uno spettacolo in cui si fondono tecnologia e poesia.

Perché sostenere COPPELIA THEATRE e HORROR VACUI project?  

a. Perché sono una comunità indipendente di artisti, attori,  videasti, studiosi, ricercatori.                                                                                                                                             b. Perché danno voce a una generazione di giovani talenti.                                                 c. Perché ritengono che la condivisione della cultura sia una  ricchezza per tutti.         d. Perché sono uno spazio libero dove pensare la cultura  contemporanea.

Tutti i festival, teatri e istituzioni partners della campagna    

. IF- Festival Internazionale di teatro di Figura (VIII edizione).

·Teatro Verdi, Milano.

. Teatro Comunale degli Arrischianti, Sarteano (SI).

·  Teatro Comunale dei Georgofili Accalorati, San Casciano dei Bagni (SI).

· Progetti Carpe Diem, Soleminis (CA).

· Spazio Teatro Magazzini della Lupa, Tuscania (VT).

· Mulino delle Civette, Vejano (VT).

· La Casaforte – spazio teatro ex convento, Napoli.

· Comune di Sarteano (SI).

· Proloco di Sarteano (SI).

· Comune di San Casciano dei Bagni (SI).

· Proloco di San Casciano dei Bagni (SI).

La nostra sfida                                                                                                               

E’ ormai cosa più che nota la difficoltà in Italia di lavorare facendo cultura, la pressoché totale mancanza di finanziamenti pubblici non permette più una progettualità a lungo raggio sia per gli artisti sia per i teatri. Il rischio costante è quello di dover rinunciare alla propria ricerca artistica per la mancanza di fondi.

Gli strumenti per affrontarla                                                                                       

Ciò che ha sempre caratterizzato l’attività di COPPELIA THEATRE e HORROR VACUI project nei loro anni di attività all’interno del panorama internazionale della cultura e dello spettacolo è la volontà di produrre progetti e realizzare spettacoli, che coinvolgessero le migliori risorse artistiche del teatro d’innovazione. Negli anni attori, musicisti, videomaker, scenografi, animatori hanno studiato, lavorato, collaborato a fianco gli uni degli altri,  in un’attività  che ha prodotto spettacoli capaci di confrontarsi con un pubblico che non si aggrega attraverso gli eventi promossi nei social network, ma che agisce sulla base della curiosità, dell’informazione sui media nazionali: un pubblico giustamente esigente e non certo compiacente. COPPELIA THEATRE e HORROR VACUI project  ritengono, da sempre, che il valore principale della produzione artistica  e dell’azione culturale che opera attraverso i linguaggi delle arti, e del teatro in particolare,  stia nella loro capacità di stimolare e favorire la formazione e la crescita individuale e collettiva delle persone e dei territori a cui quella produzione e quella azione sono rivolte.

Il piano d'azione        

II nostro piano per risolvere queste sfide ha nome Araneum Artis, un progetto di rete che coinvolge cinque centri specializzati in arti sceniche in stretto dialogo tra loro, per la costruzione di un circuito culturale alternativo a quello istituzionale, partendo dal basso,  per la sopravvivenza di una ricerca artistica che non si vuole confondere né con il mainstream né col semplice intrattenimento.

Altri modi in cui puoi sostenerci

Puoi aiutare questo progetto in modi differenti. Anche se per te fosse impossibile fare una donazione puoi comunque sostenerci diffondendo tra i tuoi contatti la nostra campagna, col passa parola, via email, via facebook oppure utilizzando gli strumenti di condivisione di Indiegogo

     costruzione), per donazioni pari a € 7.000.

L’impatto
di Barbablù sulla cultura contemporanea                     
Barbablù, dramma
espressionista per marionette e attori, tratto dall’omonimo Puppen­spiel di
Georg Trakl, è un progetto di spettacolo innovativo, un’opera dalla rara forza
poetica che unisce il linguaggio teatrale a quello cinematografico, le
tradizionali tecniche costruttive di pupazzi alla più moderna tecnologia
biorobotica. La riduzione al minimo dello sviluppo scenico, determina una
concentrazione dei valori drammatici nella densità visionaria del linguaggio,
un delirio lucido che è di per sé scena, personaggio e dramma in una continua
tensione tra ethos e pathos, tra Cosmos e Caos. Nell’attenta riscrittura fatta
dal regista e attore Marco Cavicchioli, i frequenti ricorsi al simbolismo 
si uniscono ad un verso elementare che dà all'opera una specie di perversità
derivante dalla sfasatura tra ingenuità dei mezzi espressivi e densità mistica
dei significati poetici.Una messa in scena unica nel suo genere dove il
pubblico viene accolto direttamente sul palcoscenico insieme agli attori, e che
offre allo spettatore un’esperienza estetica esclusiva, una speciale
partecipazione allo svolgimento del dramma, un punto di vista interno seppur
nascosto, uno spiare ed insieme un assistere all'inesorabile succedersi degli
accadimenti. 

Precedenti progetti realizzati con successo                                                   Abbiamo in passato già realizzato con successo uno spettacolo
di sole marionette per un pubblico di adulti, Clockwork Metaphysics, il
risultato finale di quattro intensi anni di ricerca sviluppatasi su differenti
livelli: costruttivo, drammaturgico, musicale; una ricerca che si è avvalsa
della preziosa collaborazione di svariati professionisti. Un primo studio, col
titolo Due destini, è stato presentato dalla compagnia in prima nazionale al
Teatro Verdi di Milano, lo scorso Ottobre, in apertura dell’IF, Festival
Internazionale del Teatro di Figura, riscuotendo calorosi consensi da parte
della critica e del pubblico. Da quello studio iniziale, attraverso una
paziente e calibrata  distillazione, la COPPELIA THEATRE è finalmente
giunta a realizzare uno spettacolo in cui si fondono tecnologia e poesia.

Perché
sostenere COPPELIA THEATRE e HORROR VACUI project?  a. Perché sono una comunità indipendente di artisti, attori,
 videasti, studiosi, ricercatori.                                                                                                                                             b. Perché danno voce a una generazione di giovani talenti.                                                 c. Perché ritengono che la condivisione della cultura sia una
 ricchezza per tutti.         d. Perché sono uno
spazio libero dove pensare la cultura  contemporanea.
Tutti
i festival, teatri e istituzioni partners della campagna    
. IF- Festival Internazionale di teatro di Figura
(VIII edizione).
·Teatro Verdi, Milano.
.
Teatro Comunale degli Arrischianti, Sarteano (SI).
·  Teatro Comunale dei Georgofili Accalorati, San Casciano dei Bagni (SI).
· Progetti Carpe Diem, Soleminis (CA).
· Spazio Teatro Magazzini della Lupa, Tuscania (VT).
· Mulino delle Civette, Vejano (VT).
· La Casaforte – spazio teatro ex convento, Napoli.
· Comune di Sarteano (SI).
· Proloco di Sarteano (SI).
· Comune di San Casciano dei Bagni (SI).
· Proloco di San Casciano dei Bagni (SI).
La nostra sfida                                                                                                               E’ ormai cosa più che nota la difficoltà in Italia di
lavorare facendo cultura, la pressoché totale mancanza di finanziamenti
pubblici non permette più una progettualità a lungo raggio sia per gli artisti
sia per i teatri. Il rischio costante è quello di dover rinunciare alla propria
ricerca artistica per la mancanza di fondi.
Gli strumenti per affrontarla
                     
                     
                     
                    Ciò che ha sempre caratterizzato l’attività di
COPPELIA THEATRE e HORROR VACUI project nei loro anni di attività all’interno del panorama
internazionale della cultura e dello spettacolo è la volontà di produrre progetti
e realizzare spettacoli, che coinvolgessero le migliori risorse artistiche del
teatro d’innovazione.
Negli anni attori, musicisti, videomaker, scenografi, animatori hanno
studiato, lavorato, collaborato a fianco gli uni degli altri,  in
un’attività  che ha prodotto spettacoli capaci di confrontarsi con un
pubblico che non si aggrega attraverso gli eventi promossi nei social network,
ma che agisce sulla base della curiosità, dell’informazione sui media
nazionali: un pubblico giustamente esigente e non certo compiacente. COPPELIA THEATRE e HORROR VACUI project  ritengono, da sempre, che il valore principale della produzione
artistica  e dell’azione culturale che opera attraverso i linguaggi delle
arti, e del teatro in particolare,  stia nella loro capacità di stimolare
e favorire la formazione e la crescita individuale e collettiva delle persone e
dei territori a cui quella produzione e quella azione sono rivolte.
Il piano d'azione        II nostro piano per
risolvere queste sfide ha nome Araneum Artis, un progetto di rete che
coinvolge cinque centri specializzati in arti sceniche in stretto dialogo tra
loro, per la costruzione di un circuito culturale alternativo a quello
istituzionale, partendo dal basso,  per la sopravvivenza di una ricerca
artistica che non si vuole confondere né con il mainstream né col semplice
intrattenimento.
Altri modi in cui puoi sostenerciPuoi
aiutare questo progetto in modi differenti. Anche se per te fosse impossibile fare
una donazione puoi comunque sostenerci diffondendo tra i tuoi contatti la
nostra campagna, col passa parola, via email, via facebook oppure utilizzando
gli strumenti di condivisione di Indiegogo

story:
Who, What, Why???

FERDINAND is a new producing entity created by theatermaker Jack Tamburri, for projects that meet a certain set of values. You can watch a video about FERDINAND here (https://youtu.be/FWud9nIL4Mk) but in brief, FERDINAND shows are original, site-specific, focused on the actor, and humorous.

NOT FOR PROFIT is the first of FERDINAND's projects. NOT FOR PROFIT came out of a desire to make a piece of theater for and about theater people -- why we love this work so much, why no one else seems to love it as much as we do, why the institutions that produce and distribute our work are so dysfunctional, and what we can do about it. NOT FOR PROFIT is about everyone in the building, from the ushers to the actors, from the marketers to the carpenters. It's a story about people whose jobs require them to work with big wide-open hearts, and the trouble that causes.

NOT FOR PROFIT is being built and performed in the lobby of the venerable Wilma Theater, a space with great ghosts and weird carpet. It's being made by a director, a writer, and three actors, all veterans of Philadelphia's fringe theater scene and all brilliant comedians.

NOT FOR PROFIT is for you if:

1) You are a theater person who has ever said to yourself, "Why the f#*& am I doing this??!?"

2) You love a theater person and you have ever said to them, "Why the f#*& are you doing this??!?"


In order to produce NOT FOR PROFIT we need:

$3,500

Here's why.

$300:       Philly FringeArts festival registration fee

$600:       Rehearsal & performance space rental

$180:        Insurance

$230:       Advertising

$100:       Printing (new play = lots of script pages!)

$300:      Costumes & Props

$350:       Documentation (video recording & editing)

$900:       Artist fees ($300 for each of the actors)

$207.20: IndieGoGo fees (3% 3rd-party credit card fees + 4% IGG fee)

$316.72: Contingency (10% of budget subtotal)

$16.08:   Round Number Budget Line (to make our goal $3500, which is prettier)

_______

$3500     KA-CHING!!!!!!

**You'll notice that the majority of our budget is comprised of the space rental line and the artist fee line. We have the opportunity not only to stage our performance in the lobby of the venerable Wilma Theater, but also to hold every single rehearsal there. What the Wilma is charging us is far less than the value of the space for the number of hours we're working there -- thanks, Wilma! And the artist fees are based on what we confidently feel we can raise and thus promise to our performers. If we end up being able to pay them more, we will.**


But what IS Ferdinand's Not For Profit???

NOT FOR PROFIT is an hour-long performance consisting of scenes from the life of a regional theater company. Three actors will rotate through multiple roles and perform all over the space. It will be very funny and at least a little moving.

Here's our exciting marketing blurb:

The theater is dying! Only three actors can save it, by playing dozens of roles and telling all of their stories -- from the box office to the boardroom; from the page to the stage. Everything you love and everything you hate about theaters and theater people will be... NOT FOR PROFIT!


What's in it for YOU???

All funders who contribute $12 or more receive a FREE TICKET to see a performance of NOT FOR PROFIT. This is a SAVINGS OF $3 off the price of tickets at the door.

All funders who contribute $50 or more receive a NOT FOR PROFIT t-shirt, which you can pick up when you attend the show, or which can be mailed to you after the run of the show is over.

And all funders who contribute $100 or more receive a REFERENCE IN THE SHOW! That's right, we will include your name, the name of your business, or a short phrase of your choice in the spoken text of NOT FOR PROFIT. Because we're not above doing that.

And even if you can only afford $5, we'll take it! And you'll get the personally rewarding knowledge that you have contributed to a pleasurable and meaningful hour in an interesting space for a bunch of people.

******

We fully intend to reach our goal of $3,500 but if we don't, two things happen:

1) IndieGoGo takes a 9% cut instead of 4%

2) With whatever we DO raise, we do everything we can to maintain the artist fee line for our performers, including lowering our materials budget and forgoing video documentation.

But we'll totally make our goal! Right??? Well that's UP TO YOU!!!!!!!!!!!!

If you can't contribute with $$, please spread the word!

If you're in Philadelphia and want to help out, contact Jack (ferdinandpresents@gmail.com).

If you're not in Philadelphia, share this campaign with your friends and neighbors via facebook, IndieGoGo's "share" tool, or by talking.

story:
Why Girls Raks

In addition to providing a space for young women to grow in their understanding of themselves and their bodies, we also want to instill the importance of compensating them as artists for their time and talent. We are expanding Girls Raks Bellydance and Body Image Program from a summer program to one that requires an ongoing commitment in a dance company. Your contribution will assist greatly in providing these young dancers a monthly stipend for a year. This is especially important since most Girls Raks dancers come from low income communities of color where access to paid artist positions is rare. 

Moving forward Girls Raks is an ongoing troupe of young dancers ages 13 to 24 that will receive more extensive dance instruction and an enriched intersectional curriculum around the issues of body image, self-definition and women’s rights. We also seek to deepen the connection of feminist solidarity through Girls Raks with a professional level theatrical production, Resistance and Revolution. The purpose of this campaign is to help us take this work to the next level and as a result, have a more significant impact on low-income young women of color in Oakland, where resources to help them be healthy, whole and happy are shrinking at an alarming pace.

photo credit: In Her Image Photography
For five years the Girls Raks Bellydance and Body Image Program has operated as a free summer program for low-income young women in Oakland ages 13-24 of all shapes and sizes. Girls Raks has given young women the opportunity to have a body-positive experience, free of judgment and competition. Choreography, Egyptian history, meditation and writing have been tools tools used to encourage self-awareness and connection to others. At the program’s conclusion, participants performed with professional dancers in a production. We have also provided stand-alone workshops for schools, community groups and organizations who work with women and girls. Now, in our sixth year we are excited to announce that Girls Raks is expanding to a year-round program with the introduction of the Girls Raks youth performance troupe.


The Egyptian art form of bellydance is also the perfect vehicle for connecting the struggles of women and girls, from Oakland, California to Cairo, Egypt who are challenging their society’s norms about womanhood, and establishing themselves as leaders in social movements. In addition to exposing the similarities in the violence that they face, the program provides a platform to model their resiliency, to challenge cultural norms; and to assert a definition of self, crafted from love of their culture and communities.

photo credit: Michael Baxter

Girls Raks Bellydance and Body Image Program is a fiscally sponsored project of Dancers' Group, the primary non-profit dance service organization of the San Francisco Bay Area. Contributions for the purposes of Girls Raks must be made payable to Dancers' Group and are tax-deductible. 


Who We Are

Girls Raks co-directors Etang Inyang and Tammy Johnson collectively have over 35 years of experience working with youth and communities of color as educators, performance artists, racial justice and community advocates. We have taught dance and created and presented interactive curricula. We are sharply attuned to the sensibilities of various communities and are able to skillfully adapt our program accordingly. We enjoy the challenge of introducing bellydance to new dancers. 


Other Ways You Can Help

We have always needed the support of our communities for Girls Raks. We need you now more than ever. Please contribute what you can and please share this campaign by email, on Facebook, Twitter and other social networks with your friends. Every little bit makes a difference. Thanks for supporting Girls Raks!

story:
(English) (Português) (Español)

(English).
Hello everyone, we are Fronteiras Theatre Lab, a Scottish-based theatre company dedicated to producing and promoting transcultural work. 'La Niña Barro' is our latest show, created in 2014 in partnership with Spanish company A Poc A Poc Teatre i Musica. Since it opened at the Edinburgh Fringe 2014, it has been performed at a number of venues and festivals around Spain and we would like to take the piece further. We have been invited to present it at Perimetral, an international theatre showcase in Uruguay in September 2015, alongside artists from Uruguay, Brazil, Argentina and Mexico. The organisers provide accommodation, food, and insurance, we only need the cash to pay for the return flights for our 2 performers and 1 technician. 

'La Niña Barro' is based on a collection of poems, so in order to help raise the money for flights, our director Flav ran a 24-hour poetry marathon on the 10th-11th July, reciting 426 poems in 5 languages. This was streamed online and we had 126,000 visits to the link, but unfortunately, we did not raise enough. We are extending the campaign, now offering perks (if you have already collaborated, you will receive a gift accordingly, don't worry). Please sponsor us and help spread the word. 

(Português) Olá amigxs, somos Fronteiras Theatre Lab, um grupo de teatro sediado na Escócia dedicado a produzir e promover trabalhos transculturais. 'La Niña Barro' é nosso trabalho mais recente, criado em 2014 em parceria com o grupo espanhol A Poc A Poc Teatre i Musica. Desde sua estreia no Edinburgh Fringe 2014, a peça foi apresentada em diversos locais e festivais da Espanha, mas queremos levá-la ainda mais longe. Fomos convidadas a apresentá-la na mostra internacional Perimetral, no Uruguai, em setembro de 2015, juntamente com artistas do Uruguai, Brasil, Argentina e México. A organização fornece alojamento, alimentação e seguro, só precisamos do valor para comprar as passagens de avião para nossas 2 atrizes e 1 técnica.

'La Niña Barro' foi inspirada numa coleção de poemas, então para ajudar a arrecadar fundos para os voos, nossa diretora Flavia fez uma maratona poética de 24 horas nos dias 10 e 11 de julho, recitando 426 poemas em 5 idiomas. A maratona foi transmitida ao vivo online e tivemos 126.000 acessos, mas infelizmente, não conseguimos angariar fundos suficientes. Estamos estendendo a campanha, agora oferecendo brindes (se você já colaborou, não se preocupe, receberá um presente de acordo com a doação que fez). Patrocine a gente e nos ajude a divulgar a campanha!  

(Español) Hola amigxs, somos Fronteiras Theatre Lab, un grupo de teatro sediado en Escocia dedicado a producir y difundir trabajos transculturales. 'La Niña Barro' es nuestro trabajo más reciente, creado en el 2014 juntamente con el grupo español A Poc A Poc Teatre i Musica. Desde su estreno en el Edinburgh Fringe 2014, la obra ha sido presentada en varios teatros y festivales de España, pero nos gustaría llevarla aún más lejos. Fuimos invitadas a presentarla en la muestra internacional Perimetral en Uruguay, en septiembre del 2015, al lado de artistas de Uruguay, Brasil, Argentina y México. Los organizadores ofrecen alojamiento, alimentación y asistencia médica, sólo necesitamos el importe para comprar los billetes de avión para nuestras 2 actrices y 1 técnica.

'La Niña Barro' fue inspirada por una colección de poemas, entonces para ayudar a recaudar el valor para los vuelos, nuestra directora Flavia ha hecho una maratón poética por 24 horas en los días 10 y 11 de julio, leyendo 426 poemas en 5 idiomas. La maratón fue transmitida en vivo por internet y tuvimos 126.000 accesos, pero infelizmente no logramos suficientes fondos. Seguimos con la campaña, ahora ofreciendo regalitos (si ya has contribuído, no te preocupes, que recibirás un regalito de acuerdo con tu contribución de cualquier manera). Auspicia a nosotras y ayuda a difundirlo!

um grupo de teatro sediado na Escócia dedicado a produzir e promover trabalhos
transculturais. 'La Niña Barro' é nosso trabalho mais recente, criado em 2014
em parceria com o grupo espanhol A Poc A Poc Teatre i Musica. Desde sua estreia
no Edinburgh Fringe 2014, a peça foi apresentada em diversos locais e festivais
da Espanha, mas queremos levá-la ainda mais longe. Fomos convidadas a
apresentá-la na mostra internacional Perimetral, no Uruguai, em setembro de
2015, juntamente com artistas do Uruguai, Brasil, Argentina e México. A
organização fornece alojamento, alimentação e seguro, só precisamos do valor
para comprar as passagens de avião para nossas 2 atrizes e 1 técnica.

'La Niña Barro' foi inspirada numa coleção de poemas, então para
ajudar a arrecadar fundos para os voos, nossa diretora Flavia fez uma maratona poética de 24 horas nos dias 10 e 11 de julho, recitando 426 poemas em 5 idiomas. A maratona foi transmitida ao vivo online e tivemos 126.000 acessos, mas infelizmente, não conseguimos angariar fundos suficientes. Estamos estendendo a campanha, agora oferecendo brindes (se você já colaborou, não se preocupe, receberá um presente de acordo com a doação que fez). Patrocine a gente e nos ajude a divulgar a campanha!  
(Español)

Hola amigxs, somos Fronteiras
Theatre Lab, un grupo
de teatro sediado en Escocia dedicado a producir y difundir trabajos
transculturales. 'La Niña Barro' es nuestro trabajo más reciente, creado en el
2014 juntamente con el grupo español A Poc A Poc Teatre i Musica. Desde su
estreno en el Edinburgh Fringe 2014, la obra ha sido presentada en varios
teatros y festivales de España, pero nos gustaría llevarla aún más lejos.
Fuimos invitadas a presentarla en la muestra internacional Perimetral en
Uruguay, en septiembre del 2015, al lado de artistas de Uruguay, Brasil,
Argentina y México. Los organizadores ofrecen alojamiento, alimentación y
asistencia médica, sólo necesitamos el importe para comprar los billetes de
avión para nuestras 2 actrices y 1 técnica.

'La Niña Barro' fue inspirada por una colección de poemas, entonces
para ayudar a recaudar el valor para los vuelos, nuestra directora Flavia ha hecho una maratón poética por 24 horas en los días 10 y 11 de julio, leyendo 426 poemas en 5 idiomas. La maratón fue transmitida en vivo por internet y tuvimos 126.000 accesos, pero infelizmente no logramos suficientes fondos. Seguimos con la campaña, ahora ofreciendo regalitos (si ya has contribuído, no te preocupes, que recibirás un regalito de acuerdo con tu contribución de cualquier manera). Auspicia a nosotras y ayuda a difundirlo!

story:
Welcome to the Festival of European Anglophone Theatrical Societies (FEATS)

June 2-5, 2017 in Frankfurt, Germany!

Who are we?

FEST (Frankfurt English Speaking Theatre / www.festfrankfurt.org) is celebrating 40 years in 2017 and  theatre is our passion! We are specially proud to host FEATS for the fourth time since 1991. The Lord Mayor of Frankfurt, Peter Feldmann, is honoured to sponsor FEATS on behalf of his home city. 

And what exactly is FEATS?

FEATS was started in 1976 to bring together English-speaking theatre groups across continental Europe in a festival format. The festival takes place every year in a different city and attracts hundreds of participants and visitors. No one is paid to take part in the festival; everyone covers their own expenses. But it still costs quite a bit to put on the festival - and that's where you come in...

Are there Awards?

Yes! FEATS is the largest and recognised as the best theatre festival among English-language theatre groups in Europe. A professional adjudicator reviews each production and awards prizes for best play, best actor, best stage management, etc.

We also have a fringe programme that includes short plays and workshops. A great opportunity for those groups who didn’t make it into the main festival.

Where and when does it take place?

FEATS festival will be at Frankfurt's English Theatre, in the heart of the city (www.english-theatre.de), from 2-5 June, 2017.

We expect about 250 participants here in Frankfurt to give their best. 4 evenings with a total of 12 one-act plays await you, from well-known classics to world premieres of original scripts. We hope for an audience of around 1000 over the festival.

    Who will be playing?

    The following groups will be staging these plays:

    GROUP

    CITY

    PLAY

    AUTHOR

    AATG

    The Hague

    Checking Out

    Jo Chandler

    ACTS

    Stuttgart

    Games, Frames & Fragments

    Stuart Marlow

    BATS

    Antwerp

    My Bitter Half

    Tom de Beckker

    Hamburg Players

    Hamburg

    A Slight Accident

    James Saunders

    ECC

    Brussels

    A Woman Of No Importance

    Oscar Wilde

    ENTITY

    Munich

    Numbers

    Mar Gómez Glez

    ESOC

    Darmstadt

    Men Are Beasts

    Bruno Sousa

    INPLAYERS

    Amsterdam

    Bombshells

    Joanna Murray-Smith

    NEAT

    Stuttgart

    In Juliet's Garden

    Judy Elliot McDonald

    NWTC

    Luxembourg

    And Go To Innisfree

    Jean Lenox Toddie

    TAGORA

    Strasbourg

    Lunch Girls

    Ron Hart

    DE WAANZIN

    Gent

    The Tempest

    William Shakespeare

    In addition there is a fringe festival of small, experimental plays and workshops. 

    For more information go to www.feats2017.com or https://www.facebook.com/groups/feats.eu/ 

    How can you help?

    Expenses we have that are associated directly with the festival include:

    • Theatre technicians - we need three to four technicians for 16 hours each day of the festival
    • Marketing/Printing and Promotion - posters, programmes and publicity aimed at ensuring a full theatre
    • Adjudicator - a professional ajudicator will review every play and award prizes on the last night; she needs to be paid and put up in a hotel.

    We will donate 10% of all funds raised to Save The Childen, specifically for their work with refugee children. For more information, see https://goo.gl/EZYU9L 

    Be a patron of FEATS, support theatre and help us make the festival a success. 

    Every amount contributed is most welcome and goes directly to ensuring a successful festival. If we should raise more than our initial request, the balance will go to FEST (the organizing theatre group) and be invested directly in our next production.

story:
¡A ti alguien te ha puesto en mi contra! ¡Volví a la vida de milagro para que tú nacieras! ¡Por qué soy tu madre y punto! ¿tu mamá también lo ha dicho alguna vez? Cada madre es única, pero hay frases que a todos nos han repetido y que se han convertido prácticamente en refranes. Los consejos, advertencias y amenazas con las que nos quieren conducir o proteger aumentan mientras más crecemos y quedan para toda la vida.  Para la Concho, estas palabras deben ser grabadas con fuego en su hijo Mariano, un periodista treintañero que ya quiere volar del nido, pero que es retenido por las mujeres de la casa. Clementina, la abuela maestra en el arte de la manipulación, y la hermana Catalina, eterna adolescente y aprendiz de estas damas de hierro, se unen al frente para impedir el escape del hombre de la casa y mantener el linaje familiar. ¿Podrá Mariano ser, por fin, independiente?

Para elaborar este proyecto teatral que propone la vuelta del teatro costumbrista peruano, hemos confrontado el texto con los actores. Todos coinciden en que la historia de “Tu madre, la Concho” es mucho más común de lo que nos imaginamos. Todos hemos pasado por una experiencia similar o la hemos visto de cerca, esa solapada (o a veces no tan solapada) manipulación de la madre o la abuela para no independizarnos, para quedarnos con ellas. Esta historia muestra, de alguna manera, cómo somos, cómo es nuestra dinámica familiar y cómo nos afecta individualmente.
 

El presupuesto proyectado de la obra es de un total de diez mil dólares ($ 10 000). Esta campaña busca recaudar dos mil dólares ($ 2 000), la quita parte del presupuesto total, que serán destinados a los gastos de diseño de arte, escenografía, vestuario, además de cubrir el alquiler de la sala de ensayos.

Contamos con una lista variada de recompensas para todos aquellos que nos apoyen, entre clases de cocina con la actriz protagonista Claudia Dammert, una cena con los actores, entradas de regalo para mamá, el afiche con el programa autografiado por elenco y el merchandising de la obra. Desde ahora, puedes donar desde cinco dólares ($ 5) hasta quinientos dólares ($ 500) con una tarjeta de crédito o débito de cualquier banco en cualquier parte del mundo.  

Tu apoyo en este proyecto será sustentado ante Sunat (entidad que fiscaliza los tributos en Perú). "Tu madre, La Concho” es producida por Maus Producciones, división de NODOS S.R.L en la que cada ingreso y egreso estará registrado.  

¡Tú también puedes ser vocero de nuestra campaña!

Búscanos en las redes sociales de "Tu Madre, La Concho" (Facebook, Twiiter e Instagran) y conviértete en un vocero de la campaña. Necesitamos que más peruanos y extranjeros amantes del teatro, el arte y la cultura se sumen a esta causa por el teatro peruano.   

Ficha artística

Dramaturgia: Ángelo Condemarín

Dirección: Paola Vicente
Producción general: Maus Producciones
Producción ejecutiva: Pedro Iturria
Elenco: Claudia Dammert, Sonia Seminario, Claudio Calmet y Lía Camilo.
 

"La mirada actual que Ángelo Condemarín plantea en la obra sobre nosotros mismos, es muy parecida a la que  Manuel Ascencio Segura retrataba a través de la mujer casi dos siglos antes. Esas dinámicas familiares y complejos sociales con los que los limeños fundaron nuestra república se sostienen hasta el día de hoy".

¿Qué impacto tienen las normas sociales en el rol de la mujer peruana actual? ¿Por qué es tan parecido a la mujer de inicios de república? ¿Qué buscan Clementina, Concho y Catalina al querer que Mariano no se vaya nunca de la casa familiar? ¿Protección, amor, dignidad? ¿Podemos culparlas, acaso?

Paola Vicente
Directora

"Tu madre, La Concho" es una historia inteligente y tierna con mucho qué decir (...) con un final tan sorprendente como natural"

Alonso Alegría  
Fundador del Vivero de Dramaturgia
