story:
Short Summary

With“RHYTHMS & PATTERNS” project, which will be held on April 2nd, 2016 we build upon and expand our previous work in making traditional arts available to a larger audience: visual, music and dance artists, as well as to a larger audience interested in learning more about rhythmic patterning in Bulgarian traditional art. 
The “RHYTHMS & PATTERNS” project's goals are to show the vibrance and the dynamic of the Bulgarian dance, songs and music by staged performance and open workshop,  exploring the unique patterns in the Bulgarian texstiles and embroideries.  The audience will see a week long exhibition of Bulgarian costumes, rugs, fabrics and other traditional textiles and  enjoy a performance by GORANA DANCE folk dance ensemble, including new exciting dances. The workshop will examine the patterns in the fabrics and look for relative connections with the patterns in dancing. 

This project is dedicated to the GORANA DANCE  10th Anniversary in  its making.  We want to expand our cross-cultural ties and emphasize that Bulgarian traditional culture enriches NYC diverse cultural palette in the past 10-15 years. Renown guest artists will take part in the this project: "Yasna Voices" folk choir, Miriam Milgram, ethnographic textstile specialist, among few others. 

In the past

In 2012, funded by the Manhattan Community Arts Fund, we brought together Bulgarian literature, ethnography and dance in the ”Roots and Origins" project. The exhibition of household objects from Bulgarian villages represented the time when the short story "The Windmill", by Elin Pelin, was written. The workshop explored rituals, described in the short story, while the final performance brought the story to life, along with some of the exhibits as stage designs and props.

In 2014,"The Rose Valley" performance introduced the American public and re-introduce the Bulgarian community in Manhattan to the beauty of the traditional dances, songs and music, inspired by and dedicated to the Rose Valley in Bulgaria - a place of stunning natural beauty. It was a joyous event honoring traditional rose rutuals and local celebrations.

What We Need  

We start out with a budget of $2000  private donation. We expect to combine a possible grant from Lower Manhattan Cultural Council, but our expenses exceed our funds. We ask that you help us raise another $2000. Your contribution will help us:

(1) Cover part of the expenses for a professional theater space that accommodates a  larger audience and enhances the artistic performance ($2500);

(2) Cover part of the expenses for a professional photographer and video recording ($700);

(3) Cover part of the curator’s and artists’ fees ($1500); 

(4) Prepare advertising materials ($500);

(5) Cover the expenses for a lighting designer and stage manager ($750);

(6) Cover expences of exhibition space and workshop studio ($850)


What is important to us:

Each in our own way, we nurture a passion for exploring the new meanings and relevance of traditional practices in our contemporary world. We look for interdisciplinary links between material art and dance, between rhythm and pattern, between dance and visual art. 

GORANA DANCE folk dance ensemble artists see as a vital mission to share the artistic expression of our homeland and to link closer the Bulgarian and the American communities in NYC through the power and beauty of the traditional art. 

About us:

Elissaveta Iordanova, the creative director of the project, is a dance artist and a choreographer with professional experience and in-depth knowledge of Bulgarian folkloric heritage. She is the artistic director of "Gorana Jr." -"Hristo Botev" Bulgarian School in New York and GORANA DANCE folk dance ensemble - uniting several generations of Bulgarian and American dancers around the captivating power of traditional dance. 

https://www.linkedin.com/profile/ElissavetaIordanova

GORANA DANCE folk dance ensemble, celebrating 10 years of heartfelt mission to spread the beauty of the Bulgarian folk dances in US while performing in NY, NJ, PA, IL and working to expand its outreach educational program and touring map to other states and countries. 

https://www.facebook.com/GORANADANCE

Miriam Milgram maintains a decades long passion about Balkan enthnography, makes her own texstiles and embroideries, based on Bulgarian traditional patterns and teaches others how to learn the skills of embroidery. 

http://www.miriammilgram.com

“Yasna Voices” folk choir is our partner for the past several years and continues to collect acclaims not only in NYC, but in Bulgaria as well. 

https://www.facebook.com/yasnavoices?fref=ts


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't attend the event or make a financial contribution, you can help us by:

Spreading the word to others who may be able to support us. 

Indiegogo has tools that make it easy to share our campaign within your networks.

Thank you sincerely!

story:
We are looking to finish funding for the West Coast Premier of the Obie Award winning play "Blood From A Stone".

We want YOU to be a part of the production. By donating to the project you will receive updates on casting the rest of the roles, pictures of the process and rehearsals and much more. 

The Production will be presented at the Electric Lodge in Venice, CA opening this May 7th 2016 and this additional funding is to present the production in the means that it deserves!

ABOUT THE PLAY:

Blood From A Stone tears at the gut with its wrenching story of dysfunction and destruction. A sadly relatable dark comedy that shows the most difficult trap to escape from may be our own family.

Blood From A Stone was originally produced by the New Group in New York City. The lead role was played by Ethan Hawke as he won an Obie Award for his performance receiving rave reviews. This Tour de Force production has not been seen since! Until Now!

Joanne Baron saw a scene I performed from Blood From A Stone and told me it was so powerful I should really do the entire play. And so the journey began.. 

We decided to seek out the playwright to obtain the rights to stage the West Coast premier of the production. With many up and downs, two years later we are at the home stretch and getting excited for the production and we would love for you to be apart of it. Join the excitement and come along for this ride by donating as little as $1.00! You will be included in all updates and exclusive behind the scene photos including casting, rehearsals, set-design and more. See first hand what goes into a production and where it all goes. 

  ABOUT THE VENUE

The Electric Lodge is a state of art facility and mainstay in beautiful Venice Beach, CA. Conscientiously created to be eco-friendly, The Electric Lodge is also a proud champion of sustainability in the arts. One of the first solar-powered performing arts facilities in the country, the Lodge participates in LADWP’s “Green Power” Program, uses “green” vendors to supply everything from LED lighting to biodegradable kitchen utensils and, of course, offers visitors a variety of recycling options. Click here for the Electric Lodge's Website!


CAST:

 

MARGARET - Joanne Baron - Joanne is playing the role of Margaret. Joanne is a premiere actress, producer and acting teacher. For over 30 years Joanne has been co-owner and artistic director of the Joanne Baron/DW Brown Studio in Santa Monica, CA. She is best known for her dedication to the work of Sanford Meisner and is a teacher of the Meisner Technique. She trained with Neighborhood Playhouse alum and master Meisner teacher, William Esper. Her past students include: Halle Berry, Jeff Goldblum, Robin Wright, Mariska Hargetay, Patrick Dempsey, Leslie Mann and directors Martha Coolidge and Tom Shadyac.

Joanne's producing credits include executive producer for the TV movie Profoundly Normal starring Kirstie Ally, along with Perfume, Brooklyn Babylon, Hard Luck, Intoxicating and Allie & Me, for which she won Best Actress at the River Run Film Festival. Her acting credits include This is 40, Valley Girl, National Lampoons Joy of Sex, Real Genius, Introducing Dorothy Dandridge, Drag Me to Hell, Spider-Man 2, The Prince and Me, Allie & Me, Universal Soldier, Someone to Watch Over Me. Including TV appearances such as Mad Men, Rake, Law & Order, The Shield, Curb Your Enthusiasm, Lovers and Other Strangers and the Netflix original series LOVE. 

Click Here to visit Joanne's IMDB Page!

Click here for the Baron Brown Studio's website!


TRAVIS - Chad Brannon - Chad is playing the role of Travis. Chad won the daytime Emmy for his role as Zander on "General Hospital" He has also been nominated for a Soap Opera Digest Award. 

Chad's television and film credits include his Emmy Award winning performance onGeneral Hospital along with appearances on Days of Our Lives, The Bling Ringdirected by Sofia Coppola, Friday Night Lights, What it Takes, Cold Case, CSI,Deadwood, Along with many others.

Chad has splashed over into voiceover and you may have heard him as one of the main promo voices for FOX Television Network as the signature voice for "Animation Domination" and also voicing promos for “Family Guy,” “The Simpsons,” “The Cleveland Show,” “American Dad,” “Bob’s Burgers,” “Glee,” “New Girl,” “Raising Hope,” “American Idol,” “The Teen Choice Awards” and “Dads.” He has also voiced promo and narration for ABC, CBS, Warner Brothers TV, ESPN, National Geographic, History Channel, SyFy, Travel Channel, Freemantle Media, G4 and has voiced commercial campaigns for Jack Link’s Beef Jerky, Whole Foods, Del Taco and was “The Merman” in Diet Dr. Pepper ads, as well as Tolten in the video game Lost Odyssey.

 Click Here to Visit Chad Brannon's IMDB Page!

Click Here to visit Chad Brannon's website!


SARAH - Frankie Ingrassia - Frankie has been Nominated for 2 Young Artist Awards for her work on "Secret Adventures". 

Click here to visit Frankie's IMDb Page!

Click here to view Frankie's Twitter!


YVETTE - Jossara Jinaro - She got her first agent in Chicago and started working professionally right away. Chicago reviewers referred to her as "dynamic and versatile, the ultimate chameleon," "a classic beauty who fills the stage with heat, passion, and intensity."

Jossara left Chicago to play Rene, the seductress in "Dark Rapture," at the American Conservatory Theatre. An agent approached her after her opening night and asked her to come to Los Angeles. Once she arrived in LA she was soon snatched up by Columbia Tri-Star to play the beautiful and funny Virginia Bustos in the Alma nominated sitcom "Viva Vegas." Since then, Jossara has fought for and been very fortunate to play strong, positive and non-traditional roles for Latinas.

After making her network debut recurring on Judging Amy as Cheech Marin's smart and driven activist daughter, she got the attention of Emmy-Award winning director/producer Christopher Chulack, who cast her on ER and later opposite Simon Baker on Smith. The storyline of her role on "Passions," as Rae, the strong and sexy club owner, was nominated for the 2006 GLAAD award. She went back to Colombia in 2009 to work on the Novela La Bella Ceci y El Imprudente and returned to Hollywood to work on the new series East Los High.

Her biggest love is the film world. So much so that she began to produce her own projects. A budding filmmaker with critically-acclaimed shorts and a feature that was accepted into Panavision's new filmmaker's program. She's made the film festival rounds with award-winning films like Desert Road Kill which garnered her a best supporting Actress award. You may have also seen her in "Devil's Rejects," a Rob Zombie Film, "Havoc," with Anne Hathaway, "TenTricks," with Leah Thompson, "Fly Boys," with Stephen Baldwin, Oliver Stone's "World Trade Center," opposite Maggie Gyllenhaal and Michael Pena, and recently in Lion Gate's urban hip-hop movie "Go For It!" as Loli, the queen bee of the dance floor.

Jossara still loves to do live theatre. Most recently she was the female lead in "Firehouse" from consulting producer Academy Award winner Robert Moresco and in "The Birthday Present" directed by Academy Award winner Jonathan Sanger.

Click here to visit Jossara's IMDB page!

Click here to visit Jossara's website!


BILL - Gareth Williams 

He is probably best known from his role as Mike Potter, a recurring character on the television drama Dawson's Creek.

He played astronaut James Irwin in the HBO miniseries From the Earth to the Moon, and was in such films as Malcolm X, Volcano, and The Cell. He has a long list of television credits including Time of Your Life, Angel, Law & Order,and Mad About You.

Gareth has an extensive list of film credits, including Hollywoodland with Adrien Brody, The Cell with Jennifer Lopez, and "Keith" with Jesse McCartney, Palookaville, Malcolm X with Denzel Washington and was the lead in the Danish produced road movie P.O.V. He also has a long list of TV credits, including the Tom Hanks produced miniseries "From The Earth To The Moon" where he played James B. Irwin. He also had recurring roles in "Dawsons Creek, The Shield, and Time of your Life. His career began in New York where he studied with Uta Hagen for six years

 

MATT - Ryan Lahetta - is producing the production along with playing the role of Matt. Ryan recently won "Best of" in the Hollywood Fringe Festival for his adaptation of Lanford Wilson's play "Home Free". Ryan has also been in commercials for the Big 10 Network and also a joint venture between Nike and MTVU for "The World Race". Ryan can also be seen on the Discovery Channel. Ryan's theatre credits include Golden Boy at New Village Arts Theatre in Carlsbad, CA, History Boys at Cygnet Theatre in San Diego, along with EQQUS at the Beck Center for the Arts in his home town of Cleveland, OH.

Click here to view Ryan's IMDb page!


MEET THE TEAM:

Thomas C. Dunn -  Thomas C. Dunn’s film work includes writing and directing the narrative features, “The Perfect Witness,” starring Wes Bentley and Mark Borkowski, and “The Body Tree,” starring Emma Dumont and Erica Dasher. In theater, he is the winner of Samuel French’s prestigious OOB Short Play Festival and his work has been published and produced extensively nationally and internationally.

Tommy Nohilly - Tommy Nohilly is the writer of Blood From A Stone. Where the world premier was with the New Group in New York City starring Ethan Hawke, Natasha Lyonne, Daphne Rubin-Vega, Thomas Guiry, Ann Dowd, Gordon Clapp. Thomas' acting credits include, In the Valley of Violence with John Travolta and Ethane Hawke, Boardwalk Empire and Law & Order.

Ryan Lahetta - is producing the production along with playing the role of Matt. Ryan recently won the Best of the Hollywood Fringe Festival for his adaptation of Lanford Wilson's one act "Home Free".


Theater Planners - Racquel Lehraman - Blood From a Stone is proud to have Racquel and the Theatre Planners lend their Producing expertise to the production.

Theatre Planners is a complete theatre production service company from start to finish.

Theatre Planners hit the Los Angeles scene out of a need for actors who wanted to create work for themselves on stage and either didn't know how, or just didn't have the time.

Theatre Planners has since developed into a very busy and successful outlet for actors, producers and theatre companies. Doing everything from publicity, consulting, printing and graphics, we love making productions a reality and helping to keep the theatre scene in LA alive and strong.

Racquel Lehrman is the founder and managing director of Theatre Planners. She graduated from NYU-Tisch School of the Arts and lived in NY for over eight years producing theatre. 


IN THE NEWS!


!Click here for the full article!


WHAT WE NEED AND WHY?!

$10,000 seems like a lot of money and it is! However even that is not enough to put on a great production in the not so cheap city of Los Angeles.... You think rent is expensive! Our total budget is $30,000, so we just need some help bringing it home!

Below is chart listing most of the major expenses so you have a breakdown of where the money goes. If you notice there is no line item for the actors themselves, they are donating their time to the production! So any extra money will go to help pay them something....


NO MONEY, NO PROBLEM

Sometimes you can't afford to donate financially. We understand. Don't worry there are other ways you can contribute and help Blood From A Stone.

Share this campaign with friends, family or coworkers who might be interested in helping us on our journey! Or you can easily share it on your social media for everyone to see! It's easy, all of the share on social media buttons are on the top left of the page!
story_txt:
We are looking to finish funding for the West Coast Premier of the Obie Award winning play "Blood From A Stone".
We want YOU to be a part of the production. By donating to the project you will receive updates on casting the rest of the roles, pictures of the process and rehearsals and much more. 
The Production will be presented at the Electric Lodge in Venice, CA opening this May 7th 2016 and this additional funding is to present the production in the means that it deserves!

ABOUT THE PLAY:
Blood From A Stone tears at the gut with its wrenching story of dysfunction and destruction. A sadly relatable dark comedy that shows the most difficult trap to escape from may be our own family.
Blood From A Stone was originally produced by the New Group in New York City. The lead role was played by Ethan Hawke as he won an Obie Award for his performance receiving rave reviews. This Tour de Force production has not been seen since! Until Now!

Joanne Baron saw a scene I performed from Blood From A Stone and told me it was so powerful I should really do the entire play. And so the journey began.. We decided to seek out the playwright to obtain the rights to stage the West Coast premier of the production. With many up and downs, two years later we are at the home stretch and getting excited for the production and we would love for you to be apart of it. Join the excitement and come along for this ride by donating as little as $1.00! You will be included in all updates and exclusive behind the scene photos including casting, rehearsals, set-design and more. See first hand what goes into a production and where it all goes.  
ABOUT THE VENUE

The Electric Lodge is a state of art facility and mainstay in beautiful Venice Beach, CA. Conscientiously created to be eco-friendly, The Electric Lodge is also a proud champion of sustainability in the arts. One of the first solar-powered performing arts facilities in the country, the Lodge participates in LADWP’s “Green Power” Program, uses “green” vendors to supply everything from LED lighting to biodegradable kitchen utensils and, of course, offers visitors a variety of recycling options. Click here for the Electric Lodge's Website!



CAST:

 

MARGARET - Joanne Baron - Joanne is playing the role of Margaret. Joanne is a premiere actress, producer and acting teacher. For over 30 years Joanne has been co-owner and artistic director of the Joanne Baron/DW Brown Studio in Santa Monica, CA. She is best known for her dedication to the work of Sanford Meisner and is a teacher of the Meisner Technique. She trained with Neighborhood Playhouse alum and master Meisner teacher, William Esper. Her past students include: Halle Berry, Jeff Goldblum, Robin Wright, Mariska Hargetay, Patrick Dempsey, Leslie Mann and directors Martha Coolidge and Tom Shadyac.
Joanne's producing credits include executive producer for the TV movie Profoundly Normal starring Kirstie Ally, along with Perfume, Brooklyn Babylon, Hard Luck, Intoxicating and Allie & Me, for which she won Best Actress at the River Run Film Festival. Her acting credits include This is 40, Valley Girl, National Lampoons Joy of Sex, Real Genius, Introducing Dorothy Dandridge, Drag Me to Hell, Spider-Man 2, The Prince and Me, Allie & Me, Universal Soldier, Someone to Watch Over Me. Including TV appearances such as Mad Men, Rake, Law & Order, The Shield, Curb Your Enthusiasm, Lovers and Other Strangers and the Netflix original series LOVE. 
Click Here to visit Joanne's IMDB Page!
Click here for the Baron Brown Studio's website!




TRAVIS - Chad Brannon - Chad is playing the role of Travis. Chad won the daytime Emmy for his role as Zander on "General Hospital" He has also been nominated for a Soap Opera Digest Award. 
Chad's television and film credits include his Emmy Award winning performance onGeneral Hospital along with appearances on Days of Our Lives, The Bling Ringdirected by Sofia Coppola, Friday Night Lights, What it Takes, Cold Case, CSI,Deadwood, Along with many others.
Chad has splashed over into voiceover and you may have heard him as one of the main promo voices for FOX Television Network as the signature voice for "Animation Domination" and also voicing promos for “Family Guy,” “The Simpsons,” “The Cleveland Show,” “American Dad,” “Bob’s Burgers,” “Glee,” “New Girl,” “Raising Hope,” “American Idol,” “The Teen Choice Awards” and “Dads.” He has also voiced promo and narration for ABC, CBS, Warner Brothers TV, ESPN, National Geographic, History Channel, SyFy, Travel Channel, Freemantle Media, G4 and has voiced commercial campaigns for Jack Link’s Beef Jerky, Whole Foods, Del Taco and was “The Merman” in Diet Dr. Pepper ads, as well as Tolten in the video game Lost Odyssey.
 Click Here to Visit Chad Brannon's IMDB Page!
Click Here to visit Chad Brannon's website!



SARAH - Frankie Ingrassia - Frankie has been Nominated for 2 Young Artist Awards for her work on "Secret Adventures". 
Click here to visit Frankie's IMDb Page!
Click here to view Frankie's Twitter!



YVETTE - Jossara Jinaro - She got her first agent in Chicago and started working professionally right away. Chicago reviewers referred to her as "dynamic and versatile, the ultimate chameleon," "a classic beauty who fills the stage with heat, passion, and intensity."Jossara left Chicago to play Rene, the seductress in "Dark Rapture," at the American Conservatory Theatre. An agent approached her after her opening night and asked her to come to Los Angeles. Once she arrived in LA she was soon snatched up by Columbia Tri-Star to play the beautiful and funny Virginia Bustos in the Alma nominated sitcom "Viva Vegas." Since then, Jossara has fought for and been very fortunate to play strong, positive and non-traditional roles for Latinas.After making her network debut recurring on Judging Amy as Cheech Marin's smart and driven activist daughter, she got the attention of Emmy-Award winning director/producer Christopher Chulack, who cast her on ER and later opposite Simon Baker on Smith. The storyline of her role on "Passions," as Rae, the strong and sexy club owner, was nominated for the 2006 GLAAD award. She went back to Colombia in 2009 to work on the Novela La Bella Ceci y El Imprudente and returned to Hollywood to work on the new series East Los High.Her biggest love is the film world. So much so that she began to produce her own projects. A budding filmmaker with critically-acclaimed shorts and a feature that was accepted into Panavision's new filmmaker's program. She's made the film festival rounds with award-winning films like Desert Road Kill which garnered her a best supporting Actress award. You may have also seen her in "Devil's Rejects," a Rob Zombie Film, "Havoc," with Anne Hathaway, "TenTricks," with Leah Thompson, "Fly Boys," with Stephen Baldwin, Oliver Stone's "World Trade Center," opposite Maggie Gyllenhaal and Michael Pena, and recently in Lion Gate's urban hip-hop movie "Go For It!" as Loli, the queen bee of the dance floor.Jossara still loves to do live theatre. Most recently she was the female lead in "Firehouse" from consulting producer Academy Award winner Robert Moresco and in "The Birthday Present" directed by Academy Award winner Jonathan Sanger.
Click here to visit Jossara's IMDB page!
Click here to visit Jossara's website!



BILL - Gareth Williams 
He is probably best known from
his role as Mike Potter, a recurring character on the television drama Dawson's Creek.
He played astronaut James Irwin in the HBO miniseries From the Earth to the Moon,
and was in such films as Malcolm X, Volcano, and The Cell.
He has a long list of television credits including Time of Your Life, Angel, Law & Order,and Mad About You.

Gareth has
an extensive list of film credits, including Hollywoodland with Adrien Brody, The Cell with Jennifer Lopez,
and "Keith" with Jesse McCartney, Palookaville, Malcolm
X with Denzel
Washington and was the
lead in the Danish produced road movie P.O.V.
He also has a long list of TV credits, including the Tom Hanks produced miniseries "From The
Earth To The Moon" where he played James B. Irwin. He also had recurring
roles in "Dawsons Creek, The Shield,
and Time of your Life. His
career began in New York where he studied with Uta Hagen for six years
 
MATT - Ryan Lahetta - is producing the production along with playing the role of Matt. Ryan recently won "Best of" in the Hollywood Fringe Festival for his adaptation of Lanford Wilson's play "Home Free". Ryan has also been in commercials for the Big 10 Network and also a joint venture between Nike and MTVU for "The World Race". Ryan can also be seen on the Discovery Channel. Ryan's theatre credits include Golden Boy at New Village Arts Theatre in Carlsbad, CA, History Boys at Cygnet Theatre in San Diego, along with EQQUS at the Beck Center for the Arts in his home town of Cleveland, OH.

story:
"QUEEN OF TECHNICOLOR"

-An Intimate Journey with Maureen O' Hara

 

  • WHO ARE YOU? Thanks for asking! My name is Elaine O' Dwyer. I am an Irish actress who trained at the Guildford School of Acting. I am currently living in London. I previously trained and worked as a primary school teacher in Ireland.
  • WHEN DID YOU WRITE THE PLAY? Good question! Having read Maureen's autobiography last November (2017), I made the decision to write the play. She was too interesting and captivating a person to simply brush past. I spent the last six months researching Maureen's life, watching her films, observing her interviews and even meeting her close friends. I also managed to get my hands on her own personal vanity case which I will use in the show. 
  • WHAT MAKES YOU THINK YOU CAN PLAY MAUREEN? I can relate to Maureen's character in many ways -her stubborn temperament, brashness, open-heartedness, naivety and fragility. Like Maureen, I took part in many performance competitions as a child and was part of a musical family. O' Hara and I would have got on well as children as we were both tom-boys.  I spent my childhood in wellingtons on the farm -not in pretty dresses! Maureen and I share the same outspoken nature; I think this boldness stems from our shared star-sign -we are both Leo the lion. I also happen to be a fiery redhead.
  • WHO CAN RELATE TO THIS STORY? O’ Hara’s story is one that everyone can relate to and be inspired by. A dear friend of Maureen once said “She was more than an actress. She was a person. A real person”. She was a loving mother, boisterous daughter, affectionate sister, troubled wife, loyal friend and a wonderful leading lady. Her life was thrilling yet challenging, successful yet heart-breaking. She stood up for herself during a time when the casting couch was common and when studio bosses in Hollywood controlled their stars. She went through life with plenty knocks along the way but no matter how bad things got, she never lost hope and she never stopped fighting. Anyone who has ever felt like giving up will be invigorated by O’ Hara’s story.
  • WHY DO YOU NEED ME? I need you to help support the costs of putting this remarkable story on stage. I want to tell Maureen’s story in the best way possible which means hiring a creative team and giving Maureen’s life on stage the legs it deserves. She was a woman of strength and beauty and I feel a sense of duty to honor that. In supporting this project, you will be giving this show the best chance it can get before it embarks on a national tour in 2019. I want to tell her story in an honest, respectful and theatrically compelling way. Your support will help me to bring the truth of this remarkable woman to the stage and to the world.

You Give? You Get!

 €12000 will cover the cost of:

  • hiring the venue (Belltable Arts Centre, Limerick)
  • paying professional creative team (director, stage-manager,actor, sound engineer, sound operator, lighting designer, lighting operator, musician) 
  • rehearsal space in London (director and actor are based in London)
  • marketing materials (posters, flyers, video trailer)
  • transport (flights, busses, trains, petrol costs)
  • van-hire (moving furniture for the set)
  • props 
  • costumes
  • hair and make-up artist

The Perks!

If you are one of the beautiful souls that support this project you will receive the following:​

  • A special thank you in program (€10)
  • A special thank you in program and a signed card from the creative team (€25)
  • A special thank you in program, a signed card and poster from the creative team (€50)
  • 2 tickets to the show (November 22nd OR 23rd), a special thank you in program, a signed card and poster from the creative team (€100)
  • 5 tickets to the show (November 22nd OR 23rd), a meet and greet with actor backstage after after the show, a special thank you in program, a signed card and  poster from the creative team (€500)
  • Named patron in the program, 7 tickets to the show (November 22nd OR 23rd), a signed card and poster from the creative team (€1000)
  • Private performance of the show in your home for up to 20 people (after debut performance in Ireland only), Named patron in the program, 10 tickets to the show (November 22nd OR 23rd), a signed card and poster from the creative team (€2000)

PLEASE NOTE: If you are supporting from outside of Ireland, a postage charge may be added for materials being sent to you.

If I do not reach my entire goal.... I will use the money collected to pay my creative team as best I can. The show must go on and if that means doing the show to a smaller scale, then so be it. 

The life of this show...

QUEEN OF TECHNICOLOR opens in November at Belltable Arts Centre, Limerick. This will mark the third year anniversary of Maureen O' Hara's passing.

As the old Irish saying goes: "Tús maith leath na hoibre" - a good start is half the work. Once the word about QUEEN OF TECHNICOLOR goes out, I am confident that the show will have a long life. It is my aim to tour the show around Ireland in 2019 and take the show to New York in 2020 to mark O' Hara's centenary (Maureen was born in 1920). Maureen O' Hara's fanbase is global and I have already received interest from overseas about the show. This show is the first of its' kind and is highly relevant in today's current climate with the 'Times Up' and 'Me Too' movements.

When I am passionate about something, I put everything into it. I would really appreciate your help in sharing this story with the masses. 

Ok, but what about the risks?

As with everything in life, nothing is guaranteed. I cannot guarantee that my goal of €12000 will be reached and therefore I cannot guarantee that my creative team will be paid what they deserve. If they feel that the money raised is not enough to pay them, I will have to find other ways and means.   

I can guarantee however that those who donate to the cause will receive the perks regardless. 

No money? No problem!

As an actor/writer, I am well aware that money isn't always flowing. If you are not in a position to support the show, you can help in other ways.

  • WORD OF MOUTH: You could tell your friends, family and/or strangers on the bus about the show
  • FACEBOOK:  You could like/share the Facbook page @OHARAPLAY 
  • TWITTER: You could share a tweet about the show and tag @OHARAPLAY on twitter
  • HELPER: You could help distribute flyers in cafes/restaurants/venues closer to the time and/or help to sell programmes on the night of the show 

I will be forever grateful for your support.

story:
Overview

MACHA Theatre Co. is a nonprofit organization dedicated to providing the LGBTQI community producing, writing, directing and performance opportunities within a creative environment that encourages building bridges to a mainstream audience to foster understanding between communities.

We are asking our LGBTQI community and allies to contribute towards our goal of creating new and impactful programming, and securing and renovating a new venue for MACHA Theatre to call home.

All perks receive ticket(s) to the upcoming production of Frida: Stroke of Passion in February 2020!

Meet MACHA Theatre

MACHA Theatre Co. was founded in 2000 by Artistic Producing Director Odalys Nanin because of the lack of Latina-LGBTQI stories in the theater community, the lack of leading roles for lesbians of color and a lack of real cultural inclusion or representation of the Latina lesbian experience in mainstream theater.  MACHA is an acronym Mujeres (Women) Advancing Culture, History, and Art.

For the past 19 years, MACHA has produced award winning, high quality, and exciting theater featuring lesbians of color in the title roles.  We’ve had a loyal following since the company’s inception, as well as critical acclaim for the interesting stories and great production value.  A nomadic theater company, producing two productions per year and one writing workshop, we’ve invited mentors like Maria Irene Fornes - nine time Obie Award winning playwright - and Professor Cherrie Moraga - Chicana activist - to work with us.

MACHA is the only professional theater company lead by a Latina lesbian in the United States.  With limited venues providing producing, writing, directing and performance opportunities, MACHA has been filling this role by offering cultural, equity and inclusion to both the LGBTQI community and women of color - both integral parts of the city of Los Angeles.

Thanks in part to generous grants from the Astrea Foundation and the City of West Hollywood, along with wonderful volunteers, we have continued to produce original cutting edge plays and adaptations of classic plays like Blood Wedding.

Magic was created on stage and our houses were full.  In 2007, we were able to call the venue at 1107 N. Kings Rd. - then called the Globe Playhouse - our home.  After remodeling the venue - and a rename - MACHA Theatre - the doors opened on April 22, 2007 with two new plays, Skin of Honey, directed by Odalys Nanin, and The Adventures of Lieutenant Nun, directed by Ivonne Coll.

The next ten years saw MACHA Theatre flourishing, increasing the company’s reputation as a professional theatre company.  Celebrities including Al Pacino, Jeff Goldblum, Tom Hanks, Mel Gibson, Nia Vardalos, and Sophie B. Hawkins visited and produced at MACHA’s new home.

While seeing success in the new venue, in 2017 the landlord sold the entire corner - which included MACHA Theatre.  The new landlords - real estate investors - unfortunately doubled our rent. On December 27, 2017, we had to relinquish our venue and lost over $26,000.

Since that time, it took us more than year to be able to produce again and continue with our mission.  2019 has seen MACHA produce Love Struck, and in 2020 we are bringing back the critically acclaimed production of Frida: Stroke of Passion.  

What We Need & What You Get

Since losing our performance space in 2017, it has been a constant struggle to be able to produce new programming and continue with our mission.  We would like to empower the community by creating, producing and telling impactful stories that touch so many. In addition, we are in the process of looking for a new venue to call our home.

Your contributions will help get us there.  Perks include VIP and general tickets to our upcoming production of Frida: Stroke of Passion,  mention in the program and on our website, a VIP meet and greet during reception of the show, t-shirts, a copy of the play, and our sincere gratitude. 

The Impact

When you're supporting MACHA Theatre, you're supporting:

  • New programming and creating the opportunity for the LGBTQI community to produce, write, direct, perform and tell their stories!   
  • Further creation and production of Latina-LGBTQI stories that impact the mainstream community
  • Critical funding to secure and renovate a new venue

Theatre is the oldest medium of communication where education, entertainment, and enlightenment are manifested!  Regardless of the changes in our fast moving world, theater has survived and will continue to because it is a necessity.  Viva Live Theater!

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you contribute financially or not, there are many ways you can help, including:

  • Share this campaign with friends and family.
  • Share the campaign using Indiegogo's share tools!
story_txt:
Overview
MACHA Theatre Co. is a nonprofit organization dedicated to providing the LGBTQI community producing, writing, directing and performance opportunities within a creative environment that encourages building bridges to a mainstream audience to foster understanding between communities.
We are asking our LGBTQI community and allies to contribute towards our goal of creating new and impactful programming, and securing and renovating a new venue for MACHA Theatre to call home.
All perks receive ticket(s) to the upcoming production of Frida: Stroke of Passion in February 2020!
Meet MACHA Theatre
MACHA Theatre Co. was founded in 2000 by Artistic Producing Director Odalys Nanin because of the lack of Latina-LGBTQI stories in the theater community, the lack of leading roles for lesbians of color and a lack of real cultural inclusion or representation of the Latina lesbian experience in mainstream theater.  MACHA is an acronym Mujeres (Women) Advancing Culture, History, and Art.
For the past 19 years, MACHA has produced award winning, high quality, and exciting theater featuring lesbians of color in the title roles.  We’ve had a loyal following since the company’s inception, as well as critical acclaim for the interesting stories and great production value.  A nomadic theater company, producing two productions per year and one writing workshop, we’ve invited mentors like Maria Irene Fornes - nine time Obie Award winning playwright - and Professor Cherrie Moraga - Chicana activist - to work with us.
MACHA is the only professional theater company lead by a Latina lesbian in the United States.  With limited venues providing producing, writing, directing and performance opportunities, MACHA has been filling this role by offering cultural, equity and inclusion to both the LGBTQI community and women of color - both integral parts of the city of Los Angeles.
Thanks in part to generous grants from the Astrea Foundation and the City of West Hollywood, along with wonderful volunteers, we have continued to produce original cutting edge plays and adaptations of classic plays like Blood Wedding.
Magic was created on stage and our houses were full.  In 2007, we were able to call the venue at 1107 N. Kings Rd. - then called the Globe Playhouse - our home.  After remodeling the venue - and a rename - MACHA Theatre - the doors opened on April 22, 2007 with two new plays, Skin of Honey, directed by Odalys Nanin, and The Adventures of Lieutenant Nun, directed by Ivonne Coll.
The next ten years saw MACHA Theatre flourishing, increasing the company’s reputation as a professional theatre company.  Celebrities including Al Pacino, Jeff Goldblum, Tom Hanks, Mel Gibson, Nia Vardalos, and Sophie B. Hawkins visited and produced at MACHA’s new home.
While seeing success in the new venue, in 2017 the landlord sold the entire corner - which included MACHA Theatre.  The new landlords - real estate investors - unfortunately doubled our rent. On December 27, 2017, we had to relinquish our venue and lost over $26,000.
Since that time, it took us more than year to be able to produce again and continue with our mission.  2019 has seen MACHA produce Love Struck, and in 2020 we are bringing back the critically acclaimed production of Frida: Stroke of Passion.  

What We Need & What You Get
Since losing our performance space in 2017, it has been a constant struggle to be able to produce new programming and continue with our mission.  We would like to empower the community by creating, producing and telling impactful stories that touch so many. In addition, we are in the process of looking for a new venue to call our home.
Your contributions will help get us there.  Perks include VIP and general tickets to our upcoming production of Frida: Stroke of Passion,  mention in the program and on our website, a VIP meet and greet during reception of the show, t-shirts, a copy of the play, and our sincere gratitude. 

The Impact
When you're supporting MACHA Theatre, you're supporting:

New programming and creating the opportunity for the LGBTQI community to produce, write, direct, perform and tell their stories!   
Further creation and production of Latina-LGBTQI stories that impact the mainstream community
Critical funding to secure and renovate a new venue

Theatre is the oldest medium of communication where education, entertainment, and enlightenment are manifested!  Regardless of the changes in our fast moving world, theater has survived and will continue to because it is a necessity.  Viva Live Theater!

Other Ways You Can Help
Whether you contribute financially or not, there are many ways you can help, including:

Share this campaign with friends and family.
Share the campaign using Indiegogo's share tools!

story:
Our Story

I’m sure like me,  you’ve  been feeling helpless about the way our current administration has been treating immigrants and refugees, in particular the separation of children from their parents at the border.  When I saw a CNN report about a Jewish women helping to hide a Latina mom and her two daughters from ICE after her husband was suddenly deported, it immediately brought me to the play “The Diary of Anne Frank”.  Then I thought, what if I directed the play word-for-word, but cast everyone in the attic with LatinX actors.  So along with Producers Anne Kathryn Parma and Tracey Rooney and our genius casting director Julie Gale, we embarked on putting this big production together.  Little did we realize that our 50 seat show would cause such a world wide commotion. Once people saw that we were NOT changing the Nazis to ICE agents and that we were honoring the story of Anne Frank, just told through different eyes, the tide turned and we ended up with two successful runs in Fall 2018 and Jan/Feb 2019.  We’re now bringing the show back for 3 performances in Beverly Hills and 5 in Vancouver at the Chutzpah Festival!  But we can’t do it without the help of our friends and family.  With a cast of 10, the cost is just too prohibitive. 

What We Need & What You Get

With the financial help we receive, we'd be able to lower ticket prices to student groups. School groups have been a priority for us after learning that “The Diary of Anne Frank”is no longer required reading in California Public Schools. We would like to keep the show going around the United States, reaching out to communities and school groups for performances. Our goal is to spark discussion and change where we can. 

With the donations received we would like to:

- Lower ticket prices for student groups and continue student outreach

- Continue Talk Backs after performances with Holocaust survivors 

- Help offset travel costs of touring the show

- Fund performances for those who would otherwise be unable to financially attend

With a donation to our play, we offer many perks from free tickets to a signed “Star Trek: Discovery” picture from Wilson Cruz, who has recently joined our production team.

The Impact

The production, with these actors, at this time, can and is provoking a much needed discussion on a vital topic.  For adults and especially for children, the issues our production addresses cannot continue to be ignored. We also have done multiple Talk Backs after performances with Holocaust Survivors to help draw the connections of past and present, and the similarities within them. We have already lost some of the survivors we have worked with, and it is becoming glaringly obvious that time is of the essence. We cannot keep waiting to talk about what has happened in our history, or what is happening currently in our country. 

If you care about this issue, please share our campaign and help us heal as a nation.  Together we can truly embrace the iconic saying – NEVER AGAIN!

story:
Short Summary

          Hi, my name is Gian Kamal a college student at CSU Fullerton, a performer with CMTSJ since 2007, and a danced at CDC. I am a working choreographer and have been hosting safe ways for high school performers to perform during this pandemic. 

           It was hard to see all these performer's shows get canceled due to the shutdown back in March, so I made it my mission to develop a way for them to continue their craft in the most safest way possible. This campaign is to keep our program running, not be a financial burden on our families, and continue to provide the arts to high schools students safely during the pandemic.

What We Need

          What your kindness will provide:

  • $0 to almost nothing costume fees for the performers
  • Better equipment for the performers/performance
  • Better thermometers, masks, and more onsite necessities. 

The Impact

            With your help we can really provide a fundamental learning experience for high school students with no performance outlet during this time. Each donation makes it affordable and safer for each family involved. The heath of the families is our number one priority and with your help we can make our process even safer. Theater is an outlet we can always be apart of for life, and for these students it has been taken away. Help us make a difference in our community and support the arts during this troubling time. 

Other Ways You Can Help

           If you are unable to donate today please share this with your friends and family by using the share tool on Indiegogo. Thank you so much! We appreciate your support!

story:
The Producer

My name is Carlos F. Londono-Arango and I'm a producer, writer, director, actor, and meditation teacher. You may know for me for my film All Wars End which won several local South Florida film-making awards as well as a George Washington Certificate of Merit. My most recent acting credits include; the stage play August Osage County and the short film, The Game by award winning director David Jaure.

The Writer/Director

David Walton over the last eight years, has written and directed numerous faith-based dramas produced locally to great reviews. Recently, one of his works, When It Snows in Miami, was purchased and produced by 246 The Main, a community theater in Virginia.

How the production got started...

David and I met at a local workshop for actors and writers called the Actor's Sweatshop in Miami and noticed that we both gravitated towards material that not only delved into characters living through dark nights of the soul but pushed deeper through their journeys through that internal landscape on their way towards some form of redemption and illumination. 

We saw in the Tilted Halo a chance to not only bring an important story to life but also to combine our efforts to help support social causes that mattered - in this case it was the story of people who are imprisoned and wrongfully convicted of crimes they didn't commit. In its inception this project has been meant to not just entertain but to raise awareness for the work of the Innocence Project, a non-profit dedicated to helping people wrongly convicted. 

The Story

The Tilted Halo is in and of itself a morality tale, but one with a darker, grittier edge. Set in a Florida state prison in the mid-1980’s. It introduces the audience to Milo and Josh, two people of very different backgrounds. Both convicted of murder and both profess their innocence...but only one is. The weaving together of Milo and Josh’s stories creates a complex tapestry that is at times disturbing, yet ultimately delves into the possibility of redemption. 

Support Us

Please help us reach our target and make this show the success it deserves to be. Your generous donations will help us build the set, make costumes and props and pay our actors. We can't do it without you, so dig deep and help us give stories like this the support they deserve.

Other ways to help...

If you are unable to contribute finically, all is not lost. It would be so helpful (and very much appreciated) if you could spread the word. Please share this campaign, and if you don’t already, follow us on social media.

story:
Here at the New York Shakespeare Company we are endeavoring to bring Shakespeare to the city of New York, in a way they've never seen before, whilst keeping the history and traditions alive.

Critically acclaimed and award nominated Artistic Director David Hywel Baynes, moved to New York almost 10 years ago and wants to share how he feels Shakespeare can change lives with some of the greatest stories ever put to paper. He has been studying Shakespeare for his entire adult life and has experienced the giggles of the comedies, the heartbreak of the tragedies and honor in the ultra violent history plays. 

It's a different world from Shakespeare's era filled with plague, war, political unrest and the crowning of a new ruler, BUT the methods of performing his plays, successfully, haven't. In over 400 years, since these plays were written the most enjoyable and entertaining Shakespearean performances have been those that embrace the old ways, without adding superfluous elements for the sake of it. Using a combination of classical and modern techniques, David has discovered a fresh way of telling these stories and make them accessible to everyone again, because the people were who Shakespeare wrote for in the first place.

Shakespeare's writings have a power very few other writers have even come close to. A Power that make us look at ourselves and become better people. His plays are a celebration of the beautiful insanity that is the world and if there's one thing that this world needs right now, it's more celebration. If there's one thing Shakespeare's plays tell us is that we are essentially ALL just human beings, feeling human emotions, no matter where your from.

THE AWKWARD BIT...

Very much like Shakespeare on his arrival in London from Stratford, we need help with money to get us started, even modestly, we need your help.

In the interest of keeping things to the bare essentials at first, we are looking to raise $15,000 in order to tell the gruesome story of Macbeth in the summer of 2018. We put a great deal of faith in the strength of the stories Shakespeare wrote without the trappings of lavish setting and costume, which will always come second to the words he penned down.

The majority of the budget is dedicated to location, both for performance and rehearsal, which takes up over a third of the budget alone, but New York City is the city and a Midtown location is essential to reach the most diverse and cosmopolitan audience.

In our years in the business we have experienced how hard it is for actors to survive whilst looking to build a career in entertainment. A tough thing to do at any stretch. Actors sacrifice a great deal of their time to try and be as prepared and as good for the paying audience as they can be, they deserve something for their troubles.

There's been a trend over the last 20 years of actors getting paid less and less but asked to work harder and harder, to now when it's incredibly rare for actors to receive anything for their troubles and hard work. We hope to compensate all artists, because an artist that feels appreciated is going to give their best performance. See? It's in everyone's interest. 

The Ensemble, including cast and crew, will receive a stipend of $250 for their time and effort. Gratitude is a lost virtue. We would like to help bring it back. Until we are more settled and established, we will offer what we can, but always offer something.

In performing a play like Macbeth, there are simply going to be some essential props and set dressing that are necessary when attempting such a visual play. Shakespeare's plays lend themselves to the economically sound and thriftily inclined, but there are just some things needed to do one of the greatest plays of all time justice. Just remember "Blood will have blood", and laundry is a wonderful thing when looking to get those pesky blood stains out. We will need cleaning materials. Lots of cleaning materials.

Another expenditure that is unavoidable when trying to build a name and brand is of course Marketing. We are confident that our productions will speak for themselves as the years go by, but that's no good when no-one is aware we or the production exists. Advertising and marketing is already well on it's way, with the poster designed and ready to share with the public, and tickets on sale now. 

We need people to see the show and as such we have put a modest amount toward our marketing strategy, aiming to utilize post boosting on social media which will directly target specific audiences who have already created connections with already established companies here in NYC. 

Any money helps but if we fail to reach our goal, we'll put the money we do raise, toward a postponed production of Macbeth. This play has been too long in the making to not be shown. 

What We Can Achieve

The effects of a well presented Shakespeare production can be phenomenal. It can enliven the neighborhood, bring people closer together but most of all remind us of what we are truly capable of. This is how David Hywel Baynes sees these plays.

It sounds cliché and trite to say these plays can help change lives, but they have and will continue to do so for longer than any of us will be around. Shakespeare's works have been wowing audiences for centuries. Literally CENTURIES, and still do today. Shakespeare will always be current and will always be popular. David has been performing consistently in classical productions for years having played the likes of Benedick, Richard III, Brutus to name a few. He has received such notices as:

"David Hywel Baynes is the best Richard III I've ever seen...he delivers his lines with passion and conviction and the audience hangs on to his every word." - West End Wilma

“David Hywel Baynes is a compelling, conflicted Brutus” - The Times (UK)

“the outstanding David Hywel Baynes... his beautiful verse-speaking brings crispness and clarity to Richard” - What’s On Stage

"David's performance [Macbeth] is amazingly passionate and menacing, a grand follow-up from his Offie-nominated performance in 2014′s Iris production of Richard III" - Voice Mag Uk

David prides himself on his deep connection to the works of Shakespeare. There is a duty for these plays to be treated with utmost respect, but also not to forget that they must be entertaining. Shakespeare's plays have acquired a reputation over the last few years as old fashioned. There is so much more to them than just skulls and being or not being.

The ensemble has already been working closely for years, and have developed methods that have possibilities way beyond the performance arena. Using very specific and unorthodox exercises, they have discovered methods of bringing people together and build teams from any profession or walk of life. They have instilled confidence in the timid, surprise in the cynical and strength to the weak. We don't want to limit this gift to our ensemble or those just in the entertainment field. These exercises consistently bring strangers closer together in minutes. It's a surprising and liberating and a phenomenal team building exercise.

We aim to show audiences of all ages, some of the greatest stories ever told, in a way that will bring people closer and remember what it's like to feel again. To remind people what it's like to fall so madly in love that you would rather die than live without the other. To feel a burning anger and hatred inside over not getting what we feel we deserve. We can all relate to them

What could go wrong?

Putting on a production on this specific EQUITY (actors union) showcase contract, can be fraught with dilemmas, but we have been working hard over the last couple of months to try and limit the risks we face, and are working tirelessly to have publicity, marketing and ticket sales up early in order to maximize the show's profile and effectiveness, whilst focusing on the important bit: the product. 

Artistic Director, David Hywel Baynes is undertaking the task of directing and playing the title role fresh from a successful run in London's West End, for Iris Theatre, Covent Garden. The play is not easy but it's in good hands with David and the Ensemble of a mere 7 cast members all very experienced with classical theatre. We have team of amazingly passionate and talented actors who are as yet undiscovered. They deserve to be.

There is already a tiny bit of competition in NYC to get people in the seats, and that will always be a challenge for every show. We are a young company well versed in modern media and how to utilize it properly. We will offer deals on facebook, twitter and instagram, engaging people in as many ways as possible. This will be a challenge at first but some of our budget is put by to boost posts across all social media platforms, with a very specific audience targeted.

There are always unforeseen hurdles to jump over when putting on a show, and we can only prevent so much. The NYSC team has been working in show business for 20 years and has experienced most that this business can throw at you. We're confident there is very little that could trip us up we haven't already experienced and overcome.

It's not all about the Money...Just mainly

We understand not everyone can contribute financially as they may want to, but all we need is a share of this indiegogo page, posting about us on social media (@NYShakesCo across all platforms), even shouting at a random person across the street telling them about THE NEW YORK SHAKESPEARE COMPANY.

If that is the only way you can help, or even if you can help more but don't want to, fair enough. We appreciate any help at all when it comes to sharing Shakespeare with the world, and will be forever grateful for even reading down this far. In fact, if you do read this we will offer 2 free tickets to opening night if you DM us #ireaditall on FACEBOOK. First 3 people win the tickets. 

Thank you for your support, however you express it. It means the world.

Any money helps but if we fail to reach our goal, we'll put the money we do raise, toward a postponed production of Macbeth. This play has been too long in the making to not be shown. 

What We Can Achieve
The effects of a well presented Shakespeare production can be phenomenal. It can enliven the neighborhood, bring people closer together but most of all remind us of what we are truly capable of. This is how David Hywel Baynes sees these plays.
It sounds cliché and trite to say these plays can help change lives, but they have and will continue to do so for longer than any of us will be around. Shakespeare's works have been wowing audiences for centuries. Literally CENTURIES, and still do today. Shakespeare will always be current and will always be popular. David has been performing consistently in classical productions for years having played the likes of Benedick, Richard III, Brutus to name a few. He has received such notices as:

"David Hywel Baynes is the best Richard III I've ever seen...he delivers his lines with passion and conviction and the audience hangs on to his every word." - West End Wilma
“David Hywel Baynes is a compelling, conflicted Brutus” - The Times (UK)
“the outstanding David Hywel Baynes... his beautiful verse-speaking brings crispness and clarity to Richard” - What’s On Stage
"David's performance [Macbeth] is amazingly passionate and menacing, a grand follow-up from his Offie-nominated performance in 2014′s Iris production of Richard III" - Voice Mag Uk
David prides himself on his deep connection to the works of Shakespeare. There is a duty for these plays to be treated with utmost respect, but also not to forget that they must be entertaining. Shakespeare's plays have acquired a reputation over the last few years as old fashioned. There is so much more to them than just skulls and being or not being.
The ensemble has already been working closely for years, and have developed methods that have possibilities way beyond the performance arena. Using very specific and unorthodox exercises, they have discovered methods of bringing people together and build teams from any profession or walk of life. They have instilled confidence in the timid, surprise in the cynical and strength to the weak. We don't want to limit this gift to our ensemble or those just in the entertainment field. These exercises consistently bring strangers closer together in minutes. It's a surprising and liberating and a phenomenal team building exercise.
We aim to show audiences of all ages, some of the greatest stories ever told, in a way that will bring people closer and remember what it's like to feel again. To remind people what it's like to fall so madly in love that you would rather die than live without the other. To feel a burning anger and hatred inside over not getting what we feel we deserve. We can all relate to them

What could go wrong?
Putting on a production on this specific EQUITY (actors union) showcase contract, can be fraught with dilemmas, but we have been working hard over the last couple of months to try and limit the risks we face, and are working tirelessly to have publicity, marketing and ticket sales up early in order to maximize the show's profile and effectiveness, whilst focusing on the important bit: the product. 
Artistic Director, David Hywel Baynes is undertaking the task of directing and playing the title role fresh from a successful run in London's West End, for Iris Theatre, Covent Garden. The play is not easy but it's in good hands with David and the Ensemble of a mere 7 cast members all very experienced with classical theatre. We have team of amazingly passionate and talented actors who are as yet undiscovered. They deserve to be.
There is already a tiny bit of competition in NYC to get people in the seats, and that will always be a challenge for every show. We are a young company well versed in modern media and how to utilize it properly. We will offer deals on facebook, twitter and instagram, engaging people in as many ways as possible. This will be a challenge at first but some of our budget is put by to boost posts across all social media platforms, with a very specific audience targeted.
There are always unforeseen hurdles to jump over when putting on a show, and we can only prevent so much. The NYSC team has been working in show business for 20 years and has experienced most that this business can throw at you. We're confident there is very little that could trip us up we haven't already experienced and overcome.

It's not all about the Money...Just mainly
We understand not everyone can contribute financially as they may want to, but all we need is a share of this indiegogo page, posting about us on social media (@NYShakesCo across all platforms), even shouting at a random person across the street telling them about THE NEW YORK SHAKESPEARE COMPANY.
If that is the only way you can help, or even if you can help more but don't want to, fair enough. We appreciate any help at all when it comes to sharing Shakespeare with the world, and will be forever grateful for even reading down this far. In fact, if you do read this we will offer 2 free tickets to opening night if you DM us #ireaditall on FACEBOOK. First 3 people win the tickets. 
Thank you for your support, however you express it. It means the world.

story:
Who We Are

New Mexico Dance Project is a contemporary dance company based in Santa Fe, New Mexico. Founded in 2019 by husband and wife team Scarlett Wynne and Erik Sampson, NMDP produces original concert works and short films that focus on capturing the imagination and inspiring curiosity. The company exists to widen the spectrum of how dance is accessed and experienced by its audience; emphasizing the art of storytelling as a means of bridging the divides brought on by cultural, racial, and social differences.  


What We Need

Pieces of Yellow is a live performance installation designed to be presented in a variety of venues. Our goal is to tour this body of work throughout New Mexico for the remainder of the year. Currently, we have four established bookings throughout March and April and are in conversation with several festivals for Summer 2019. 

In order to produce "Pieces of Yellow ", additional funding is needed to purchase the technical and production elements required for the performance. Below is the cost breakdown for the remaining components. 

Cost Breakdown: 

  • Props: $450 
  • Costumes: $550 
  • Marketing: $300  (Print, Ad, Social)
  • Venue/Rehearsal Space Rental: $500
  • Merchandise: $250
  • Technical  Equipment: $400 

New Mexico Dance Project is a startup performance company and is not a 501(c)3 not-for-profit corporation. Therefore, funds raised by this campaign are used solely for the production elements of the project and are not used for monetary compensation of the directors/dancers. 

(All funding for this project goes directly to offsetting project expenses presently being paid for out of pocket by the founders.)

 

Why We Do It

New Mexico Dance Project is an extension of our vision to see dance made more accessible to our local community while deconstructing the stigma that surrounds concert performance art.  

At the core of who we are is a firm belief in the power of art to change lives and how we identify with ourselves and others. 

The purpose of the "Pieces of Yellow" project is to take our vision and make it real in the form of live performances that generate a new conversation about the role dance can play in our community.

 

How You Can Help

New Mexico Dance Project is currently seeking supporters who can spread the word about our vision and what we are trying to do with dance in our community. If you are unable to support us with financial resources at this time you can support us with your voice. Tell people about us. Contact us for collaborations (we love meeting new artists). Follow us on Facebook or Instagram. Every little bit of support helps us continue to build to our dream of establishing a resident dance company committed to serving the great state of New Mexico.

story:
The Plan

Bring LEAVING PRINCE CHARMING to Hollywood Fringe Festival 2019, pack out the house, and give it a launching pad to go beyond the streets of LA. 
 

The Why

I was told that my show ought to be shown to teenagers and that's exactly what I intend to do. My goal is to leverage my time at HFF 2019 to find college booking agency representation. That way I can bring my show to teenagers and young adults across the country. 
 

Here's What I Need To Get The Job Done

Let's break it down:

  • HFF Registration Fee - $300
  • Venue Rental and Insurance - $800
  • Technician for Tech Rehearsal - $50
  • Technician for 3 Show Dates - $150
  • Postcards - ~$35
  • 150 Programs - $90
  • Mini Wands for Marketing - ~$80
  • Full Page Ad in HFF Guide - $750
  • Tech, group and private coaching - X
  • Grand Total = $2,630

And that doesn't even include the fee Indiegogo takes from my campaign or the cost of seeing other Fringe shows (which is how many Fringe participants bring in other Fringe participants to their own shows)!

 

What You Get

You are investing in my passion and my career and for that I am infinitely thankful. You can donate any amount or claim one of these perks granted to you by the Fairytale Kingdom:

  • $10 - Name in Program
  • $20 - Name in Program, Thank You Note from Fairy Godmother
  • $50 - Name in Program, Thank You Note from Fairy Godmother, 1 ticket
  • $100 - Name in Program, Thank You Note from Fairy Godmother, 2 tickets
  • $200 and up - Name in Program, Thank You Note from Fairy Godmother, 4 tickets, front row seats

 

Risks & Challenges

My main challenge is filling 46 seats per night for three nights. 

To fill the house each night, I must attend weekly networking events as well as purchase tickets to see other Fringe participants shows in order to encourage them to come to mine. Any additional donations above my goal will go directly towards my gas tank and these networking nights.

 

After Fringe...

The final curtain call isn't the end of LPC. I'm going to submit my show to college booking agencies in hopes of booking college shows around the US. My time at Hollywood Fringe Festival will not only bolster my chances of getting representation but it will give me even more hands-on experience networking and marketing my show. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are so many other ways you can contribute! Sharing this link, purchasing a ticket to the show, bringing friends, and telling your college booking agent friend (*cough cough*) about the show are just a few ways you can help me spread the word about not-so-healthy relationships. I can assure you that any contribution makes my day and makes Fairy Godmother's magic sparkle a little brighter.

story:
The Buried Story So Far...

We wrote Buried at University in Sheffield, England, whilst we were in our final semester there in 2017. The show itself is a folk-inspired, darkly comedic musical about Rose and Harry; two serial killers who accidentally meet on a date. It’s a romantic-comedy with a razor sharp edge, and through its biting wit and soaring, soulful score, Buried demonstrates how love is unique to everyone whilst illuminating the darkness in us all.

We took Buried to the Edinburgh Fringe Festival in 2017 and it became a festival hit.  We sold out all performances of our 155 seater venue, and went on to win the Sunday Times National Student Drama Festival Edinburgh Award. This award led to further sell-out runs at the Leicester Curve, where we won The Cameron Mackintosh Award, and at the Pleasance Theatre, London, where we also recorded a live album. You can listen to it here:

On Spotify - https://open.spotify.com/album/4jQPUYFvwIB6RZfr...

On Apple Music - https://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/buried-the-mu... 

We then returned to Edinburgh in 2018 after a year’s development and sold out our run for the second time, this time in a 200 seater venue with many audience members coming back to see the show multiple times. We even sold out of t-shirts before our run's midway point.

Buried has also been incredibly well received critically.  British Theatre described the show as "perversely charming and entertaining", remarking on the "richly melodic and soulful” score, and Paul Vale from The Stage said the songs were “some of the best you will possibly hear in Edinburgh”. The Skinny called the show “a witty, remarkably touching and sentimental journey of self-respect and love. Oh, and a whole lot of murder.”, and Musical Theatre Review stated that “Buried is something we are all looking for – one of those nuggets that is waiting to be found”. 

 

What is The New York Musical Theatre Festival?

The New York Musical Theatre Festival is the most prestigious new musical festival in the world, known locally as ‘The Sundance of Musical Theatre’ for its role as the birthplace of exciting, genre-busting new musical theatre. Shows that take part in the festival are regularly transferred to longer Off-Broadway runs, US tours and some have even transferred to Broadway. Here is a link to the website for more information - http://www.nymf.org/about/alumni-awards/ 

 

What could happen with Buried at the festival?

When in New York in mid-March, Tom and Cordelia found that the buzz surrounding Buried’s participation in NYMF is already building rapidly, for both its unique music, tone and subject matter. 

Mainstream entertainment is saturated with serial killer themes, particularly in America. Their audiences are not only fascinated by it, but the preponderance of serial killer series such as Dexter, The Following, Mindhunter, True Detective, The Alienist, Conversations With A Killer and many others have led to a super appetite for this genre. 

Combined with its very British dark humour and the unconventional yet catchy score, we’re confident that Buried will appeal to a very wide audience and to the media as well. Looking at NYMF’s track record of successes, we think that Buried has a very promising commercial future, and is a rare, truly exciting, home-grown project to get behind.

 

The Money...

Up until now, we have been independently funding each stage of the production with profit from the previous show, merchandise and crowdfunding, but the cost of getting our show to New York is a different ball game. 

Our travel and accommodation costs are inevitably high (turns out you can’t get the Megabus to New York), alongside hiring a general manager, insurance, set, lighting and sound designers amongst many other things that unfortunately really do add up! 

This £15,000 would provide us with a solid chunk of what we need to get Buried over to New York, but we are also seeking funding elsewhere to add to the production value of the show, the marketing/advertising that could give Buried bigger audiences when over there, rehearsal space when in New York and more staff involved in our production team to ensure the show runs as smoothly as possible.  Our ideal budget is nearing £50,000, so you can imagine our constant states of stress/emotional breakdowns...

If you would like to donate a bigger sum privately please email Tom and Cordelia at williamsodriscoll@gmail.com .  It is worth noting that if you are a US taxpayer all funding can be donated directly to the New York Musical Theatre Festival as a fiscal sponsor and then transferred to us, meaning it is tax deductible. The New York Musical Theatre Festival is a certified 501(c)(3) organisation so under the US Internal Revenue Code, it is tax exempt. 

 

Why You Should Donate...

Alongside our range of great perks you'll see on the side, you'd be helping a grassroots, British musical make its first steps into New York Theatre. 

For 2 years we've been doing this show for the love, with no promise of any return or definite future life. Now, we're on the precipice of potentially really big things for the show, but as young, up and coming artists with little to no connections to the upper echelons of theatre funding, its been a struggle to get through to those who could help. Unfortunately, if we don't manage to raise this money we simply can't go.

We really believe in Buried and everyone involved, and we think our track record of success from the last 2 years has proved we're more than ready for this, but we really need this financial help to push it through to these hugely exciting next steps.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to contribute financially, we would be eternally grateful if you could share this campaign around with anyone you can think of who might want to donate. We're very quickly running out of time, so any person who could be interested is definitely worth being told!

Every share really could make us one step closer to Buried making it to New York.

 

Thanks so much for reading, 

Tom and Cordelia

story:
Why your donation to foldA matters ?

foldA’s programming is structured to support artists creating theatre in a digital age.

Similar to Bob Dylan's  transition from acoustic to electric guitar, live theatre is also moving through a monumental, electric shift. Theatre is poised to grow, as is tech. foldA is the catalyst to encourage how curious artists can better understand and apply digital  technology to live performances that will trigger social and theatrical change in a meaningful way.

foldA is an annual national meet-up dedicated to evolving theatrical form and is the only one like it in Canada. Your funding gives agency and empowerment to the theatre community  to continue to grow and shift with the digital age, instead of feeling "left behind".

With your donation, foldA's leadership, and a collaborative growth mindset,  we will have the tools and the agency to continue to be the change makers of live performance art that connects the URL <Internet> and the IRL <In Real Life>.
