story:
// GET YOUR TICKET NOW on

 07.-08.09.2016, 8pm., at Pfarre St. Getrud, Maynollogasse 3, 1180 Vienna.  

// HELP US TO SET UP THE SHOW FOR:

08.+11.08.2016, 8pm. at St. Michael's Church, Camden Road, St Pancras, London, NW1 9LQ.

It's possible to create a drama play with a team of 20, it's only possible to bring it to it's performance with many people involved! Help us setting up the world premiere of 'Viele Gruesse, Michael Kohlhaas!' in London to make an impact due to the actual political situation in EU's recently lost city!

Every € counts, thank you for helping us crossing the border with your support!


„Viele Grüße, Michael Kohlhaas!“ was written 1977 by the German-Romanian author Frieder Schuller after the novella by Heinrich von Kleist and prohibited 1978 by the communist Romania. The play has never been shown on stage as Schuller was expelled out of the country immediately after the first rehearsals. He escaped to Germany shortly after the incidents, the play however has since been forgotten. 

Borders - Cutting point of personal and collective missunderstandings. Up to date in 19th century of Kleist, as well as in communist Romania 1978 we still find ourselves today confronted by many borders and demarcations. With the original manuscript in our hands we want to make the first step to bring Schullers play out of the oblivion to its world premiere! 

As Austrian artists our main performance takes place in Vienna. But due to the actual political situation it's the right time to take the drama play over the border to London! With setting up an premiere in the UK we want to give an impulse to overthink as many borders, limitations and demarcations as possible.

For that we cross our own borders as far as possible, but (un)fortunately we can't do this only by our own. Money is once again the biggest border for so many artists. Let's cross it together and set up the world premiere of 'Viele Gruesse, Michael Kohlhaas!'in EUs recently lost city!


We are a group of Austrian freelance artists and actors got together to produce, create and perform the prohibited and forgotten 'Viele Gruesse, Michael Kohlhaas!' and not at least to tell the story about Frieder Schuller and his eviction from communist Romania as an example of many citizens being demarcated and expelled from their home country. With support of the author himself initiator and lead actor Florian Reichl set up a 20-headed team to cross the borders with them, including the heart and soul of the production the director Emel Heinreich.



Born 1962 in Istanbul Emel Heinreich moved to Vienna 1989 to study dramatics and complemented her education at the International Theatre Laboratory Vienna and the Théâtre du Soleil Paris with Ariane Mnouchkine. Besides multiple educational activities she worked as an assistant director, performer and actress. She also studied mask theatre in Indonesia and is currently working as a director. Excitedly she took the function of the director when Florian Reichl offered it to her to especially to express the highly topical sociopolitical aspects and circumstances the story adresses through the performance.

Florian Reichl was born 1987 in Gössendorf near Graz. He held a solo cabaret programme in 2014 and is co-founder of the theatre company ‚Theaterklotz Asteroid‘ since 2015/16. After many  abidances in London he travelled to Katzendorf for searching and finding Frieder Schuller and his manuscript of "Viele Grüße, Michael Kohlhaas!". He currently lives in Vienna and London to dedicate himself to the project wholeheartedly.




The coper Michael Kohlhaas is stopped at an arbitrarily established border and forced to deposit two of his horses solely because he does not have a passport. As he returns to clarify the illegitimate situation he finds his horses collapsing and near death under immense fieldwork. He feels betrayed. 

He refuses to take his horses back and claims for their primarily state of health. His following lawsuit goes through all levels of jurisdiction. Michael looses permanentely and is getting nothing out of it but scorn and derision. When finally his wife gets deadly injured by one of the earl's watchmen, it‘s enough! 

He sells all his belongings and trains his farmhands to fight back. The small rout receives a lot of popularity among the population and grows quickly to a serious threat for the whole country. Kohlhaas has to realize: The whole situation has nothing to do with justice anymore... 


The play about the ancient German character Michael Kohlhaas questions borders, the necessity of passports and the conflicts between a self empowering individual and the authorities. What remains in the end are many questions: 

How far should self empowerment go? What's righteous and how far do we go to be right after all? Why do we sometimes fail to forgive someone else and what can we do not to always fight against each other?

Repeating itself, the story of Michael Kohlhaas and Frieder Schuller are just representations of many borders been drawn, citizens been expelled and battles been fought over disagreements, misunderstandings and oppositions. 


We have a big goal in mind: Crossing borders instead of drawing them. Connecting, uniting and loosing our own borders. Boundlessness and the freedom to travel within Europe seems due to the actual political situation no more as a matter of course, least of all it isn't for a lot of people all around the world.

Performing in London would be a great opportunity for us all! As human beings we all do automatically set up borders, personal ones as well as national demarcations at a bigger scale. Let's just overthink them and make a statement with a set up show in London.

For us, money (un)fortunately gets a limitation at some point. Setting up an international dama play can be expensive. Every cent contributed to us is going straight to our play and hard working artists. Flights, logistics, housing and regular meals during the rehearsals and performances require a higher budget than performing in our home town in Austria. We don't have that many needs, but that doesn't mean we have no needs at all :)

With your help the world premiere of 'Viele Gruesse, Michael Kohlhaas!' is nearly within reach! If we gain at least the sum of 10.000€ the remaining costs for the show will finally be covered and the performance is going to take place at the awesome St. Michael's Church in Camden Town, London. But every cent counts and if we are not able to reach the goal nothing is lost at all. We'll put the money straight into our show in Austria and safe it to bring 'Viele Gruesse, Michael Kohlaas!' to places where the political statement can inspire people to overthink personal and national borders, for example to Frieder Schullers homecountry Romania.

We are thankful for every help we get. And for us, helping means more likely doing it together! We cross our borders to make it possible, let's cross them together!


Money pays the bills, even though money is not everything! Without a lot of people supporting us, 'Viele Grüße, Michael Kohlhaas!' wouldn't be possible. Just share the project and our crowdfunding campaign with others! 


A BIG HUGE THANK YOU just for everyone helping us and creating this awesome possibility with us!


https://vielegruessemichaelkohlhaas.wordpress.com/


'Viele Gruesse, Michael Kohlhaas!' tells the story about authorities establishing rules, orders and restrictions over their citizens, sometimes arbitrary ones. As priviledged people we have a lot of possibilities, even when we can't see them at first glance. For many other people borders have a large impact on their lifes and often their survival. With our performance we also arbitrarily divide the spectators area into two parties: A VIP section and an area for ordinary people.


SHOW DATES, TICKETS AND PACKAGES:

The Austrian shows of 'Viele Gruesse, Michael Kohlhaas!' takes place at 8pm. on 07.-08.09.2016 at Pfarre St. Getrud, Maynollogasse 3, 1180 Vienna. 

The London shows would take place at 8pm. on 08.+11.08.2016 at St. Michael's Church, Camden Road, St Pancras, London, NW1 9LQ.

The show will be performed in German language. Translations are provided via Smartphone-App and projected subtitles.

Why are only tickes for the Austrian show available?

With your help we are still setting up our show in London. To fully guarantee that you receive everything you have paid for only Austrian tickets are avaiable by now. Once we hit the 10.000€ mark we unveil the secret perks for our tickets in London. For further information please visit our website and facebook page.

How do I choose my prefered show at Pfarre St. Gertrud, Vienna?

Once the Indiegogo campaign has closed, we will send a survey to you. In that survey you can choose your prefered date of show. Only a limited amount of pre-sale tickets are available here on Indiegogo, so you don't have to worry your prefered show gets over-booked.

How do I receive my ticket?

Making the transaction process of your ticket the easiest way possible for you, you will receive a booking confirmation once the Indiegogo campaign has closed and you have finished our ticket survey giving in the information of your prefered date of show. Before the beginning of each show you can pick up your ticket on location with your received booking number.

How do I receive my package items?

Along with your ticket you will receive your package extras on location properly compiled and wrapped so nothing gets lost or late by mail.


VIP DECLARATION AND EXTRAS:

Thank you for choosing a VIP ticket! In appreciation of your support we offer a free seat reservation to all of our pre-sale VIPs along with your name mentioned in our booklet. All VIPs are also offered a welcome drink and a free, delicious buffet only available within the VIP section.

How do I make a seat reservation?

After the Indiegogo campaign has closed we contact you for a seat reservation. We love you VIP supporters, so the seat reservation is only available to you. You have a free choice of your seat depending on the availability. Please choose carefully, the reservation unfortunately can not be changed.

Can I have a different name related to my reward?

As a VIP we give a mention or dedication of yours in our booklet and on your seat. You can easlily choose a different name. After the Indiegogo campaign has closed we send a survey to you where you can put in all informations.


NON-TICKET RELATED REWARDS:

How do I choose my T-shirt size and color?

After the Kickstarter campaign has closed we send a survey to you. In that survey you will be able to choose the size and prefered design of your T-shirt.

How do I receive my rewards?

To make the transaction process most transparent for you, you will receive your reward by certified mail only once the Indiegogo campaign has closed. When not specified otherwise in the reward description we ship all over the world. The fordwarding costs are already included, you don't have to pay an extra. We will choose the delivery services carefully depending on your shipping adress.

Can I pick up my reward on location?

There is no problem on picking up your reward on location. Just put in the information of the prefered pickup location in the survey we will send to you after the Indiegogo campaign has closed.

description we ship all over the world. The fordwarding costs are
already included, you don't have to pay an extra. We will choose the delivery services carefully depending on your shipping adress.


Can I
pick up my reward on location?


There
is no problem on picking up your reward on location. Just put in the
information of the prefered pickup location in the survey we will
send to you after the Indiegogo campaign has closed.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. 

RENOWNED DIRECTOR DAVID FOFI (pictured above) JOINS "GOD'S WAITING ROOM" 

Elephant Theater Artistic Director David Fofi will direct the upcoming production of "God's Waiting Room". Among his credits for The Elephant Theater are: "Unorganized Crime" featuring Chazz Palminteri; "In Arabia We'd All Be Kings"; "The Idea Man" and "Little Flower of East Orange" to name only a few of a vast number.

The Los Angeles Times has said of David:

For "In Arabia..." “David Fofi, one of LA’s best directors, keeps his exceptional cast grounded in each moment, their comedy and heartbreak feels equally earned and the artistic discipline on view here finds strong chemistry”- LA TIMES - CRITIC’S CHOICE

For "Farm Boy" “Fofi’s knack for illuminating text through simplicity and suggestion has never been sharper.” - LA TIMES

Review after Review, David is on top. New York Times, L.A. Weekly, Backstage, Huffington Post, Hollywood Reporter all rave. 

 

 

"God's Waiting Room" features RANDY VASQUEZ, best known for his role of Victor "Gunny" Galindez on the hit drama, JAG, starring David James Elliott. Randy was also a regular on "Love Boat, The Next Generation" which starred Robert Urich and was a recurring guest on "Knots Landing". Randy received extraordinary reviews for his portrayal of Reverend Carlos Mendez in "God's Waiting Room".

Denise Carole has had a long standing career in Regional Theater. She has appeared on stages from Denver to Los Angeles in key roles. Her credits include Mrs. Keller in "The Miracle Worker", Nettie in "The Subject Was Roses", Diane in "The Little Dog Laughed" and Mary in "Caught in the Net". She has appeared on TV in "Donovan and Simms" and "Criminal Minds". One Fringe viewer wrote of her performance:  "Denise Carole was remarkable in this show, you could not take your eyes off of her, even while wanting desperately to hate her character. Just a force of nature roaming the stage, and giving emotion and even empathy to a character who ought to be unforgivable."

Randy and Denise will reprise their roles in the upcoming March production.

 

  • Robert Austin Rossi is an Award Winning Writer living in the Los Angeles area. He has placed in contests such as BlueCat Screenplay Competition, Table Read My Screenplay in London, and Beverly Hills Screenplay competition to name a few. His short film, "The Bench" won numerous awards at film festivals including the Best Shorts and New York Screenings.
  • Profile/Credits-  June 4, 2016 "God's Waiting Room" as a workshop piece at Hollywood Fringe.  2015 "The Bench", a short film directed by Tom Lazarus, Written by Robert Austin Rossi with Festival wins at Culver City Film Festival, Best Shorts Competition, New York Screenings, Los Angeles Independent Film Festival, Los Angeles CineFest, L.A. Shorts, Best Independents International Film Festival. "Patriot/Traitor", Screenplay by Robert Austin Rossi was a Quarter Finalist in Nashville Screenwriting Competition and a top 50 for International Screenwriting Association. The acclaimed "The Dowager" was a quarter finalist at the prestigious BlueCat Screenplay Competition and the WE Screenplay Competition.  It was a Semi-Finalist in London at Table Read My Screenplay and a Finalist at Chicago Screenplay and Beverly Hills Screenplay Competitions. His latest work, "Edith" about First Lady Edith Bolling Wilson was one of 15 finalists in 2016's First Ten Pages Screenwriting Competition.
  • Bob studied under Ellen Sandler of "Everybody Loves Raymond", "My Sister Sam", "Kate and Allie".
  • Bob also studied under Barney Lichtenstein, an in demand Script Analyst for Amblin Entertainment, Imagine and The Sundance Institute.
  • A long relationship with his writing mentor, Tom Lazarus, whose film "Stigmata" remains a top favorite among movie audiences. Tom's work on television includes: "Jake and the Fatman", "Starman", "Hunter", and "Knight Rider". Tom directed Bob's "The Bench" for which he won a Best Shorts Recognition Award.
  • As one viewer wrote of "God's Waiting Room": "This production is a MUST SEE! We can ALL relate on some level to the characters portrayed in this performance. I am left with a haunting desire to look at… and possibly repair some of the tragic dysfunction that exists in my own family."
  • "God's Waiting Room" is scheduled to be staged in March 2017 with full set and costumes. The play will be costly to present to the public. We are looking to defray some of those costs through contributions from supporters like you.
  • The play will star 

    RANDY VASQUEZ JOINS THE CAST OF "GOD'S WAITING ROOM"

    Distinguished actor/director Randy Vasquez has joined the cast of “God’s Waiting Room” in the role of Carlos Mendez. Audiences will remember Randy for his long running role of Gunnery Sgt. Victor “Gunny” Galindez on the CBS hit show “JAG” with David James Elliott. Randy’s long television career includes roles on “Highway to Heaven”, “Hill Street Blues”, as Ramon Fonseca on “Santa Barbara”, “Knots Landing”. a regular on "Acapulco H.E.A.T. with Catherine Oxenberg, NCIS, and Shameless. Randy was nominated for an AKMA Award for his work on “Love Boat: The Next Wave” and he directed the widely acclaimed documentary “The Thick Dark Fog” which won the 2011 American Indian Movie Award. We are happy to have Randy aboard the premiere of this psychological drama.

  • Denise Carole whose stage work includes "The Subject Was Roses", "The Miracle Worker" and numerous other productions. Her film and television credits include: "Criminal Minds", "Donovan and Simms", "Eternal", "Allegiance", "Sperm Donor" and others.

    ...
  • Any amount helps.
  • Contributions of $5000 or more will list you as an Executive Producer of the play; contributions of $1000 or more will earn you a credit as a Producer and contributions of $250 to $500 will list you as a Major Donor. Any and all contributions will list you as a Patron.
  • The play will cost approximately $25,000 to produce for a 4 to 6 week run.
  • All contributions of $100 or more will receive two VIP tickets to the play.
  • Funding for the show will go directly into the production: scene design, costumes, lighting design, facility rental, etc.
  • Your contribution will help to bring this touching play to life and propel us toward our goal of bringing the play to New York.

In this era of uncertainty and unkindness, this play examines alienation from family, prejudices of various kinds and how they originate. It delves into the psyche of a woman, a man, religious figures and the people they affect on a daily basis. Audience members leave as one Hollywood Fringe viewer wrote: "This production is a MUST SEE! We can ALL relate on some level to the characters portrayed in this performance. I am left with a haunting desire to look at… and possibly repair some of the tragic dysfunction that exists in my own family."

Risks & Challenges

This will be a first stage effort for the writer. His successful track record will be challenged by Los Angeles critics who have a reputation as difficult on new playwrights. 

The company will have an intense rehearsal schedule with rewrites as problems are unveiled. A table reading of the play on December 7, 2016 is scheduled to ferret out some of the loose dialogue which may still exist.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute but live in The Los Angeles area, we're looking for volunteers at all levels. Help us build or paint the set, be a stagehand, usher at performances. We would love to see you.

story:
Short Summary

Beach Party, is a performance devised by 38 Buried Roses influenced by the methodologies and practices of European Theatre in the past century. The collective sets out on a journey through the moving sands of today's world. Come to see this visual theatre with live music, moving bodies and an overwhelming atmosphere. The ensemble have created the piece out of their rich background in avant-garde European actor training.

This project has grown from the individuals research into theatre practice and we as a collective remain passionate about the relationship between PRACTICE and RESEARCH. By combining our shared research and interest in a number of different theatrical practices we hope to create an exciting and innovative piece of theatre together.

We are importantly an EU company with performers from the UK, France, Czech republic, Poland and Estonia. We and our generation believe in the unity of our countries and strongly believe that we can stay united through our creative connection. Which is key in these uncertain times.

What We Need & What You Get

We ask you to give as much as you can to help us to publicise this important work at the Edinburgh Fringe . We already have the venue and the team, we just need YOU to help us get ourselves out there!

The money you pledge will go towards, posters and flyers, the creation of programs and our advertising campaign, which will include flyering in Edinburgh, advertising in the program of the Edinburgh Fringe and a few happenings here and there between shows ( so keep your eyes peeled if your there!)

The Impact

We are a truly European company hoping to be able to make work together that stands up and means something in these changing tides. We hope to be able to combine and present the variety of skills that we all posses and our varied training and passions to perform something exciting and entertaining to our audience.

We are very excited to develop something as a collective inspired and supported by the success of our first work and we really hope you will support the collective in what will be one of the first steps into a professional world for all of us.

 

Risks & Challenges

We are up against time with this campaign, we hope to be able to raise £500 in 16 days. Due to unforeseen circumstances members of the collective will not be able to take part in this project for Edinburgh and we have not received the funding we had hoped to have had. So...we have had to do a lot of re planning but we are confident and we are enthusiastic and we DO believe we can make a wonderful and successful show in the time that we do have! 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help us financially which we absolutely understand, please, please, please take a look at our website and share us on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.

FACEBOOK:
https://www.facebook.com/38BuriedRoses/?fref=ts

TWITTER:
https://twitter.com/38_buried_roses

INSTAGRAM:
https://www.instagram.com/38buriedroses/

Every little helps, and we need to spread the word. You can also keep your eyes out for our sibling collectives also making wonderful work in Edinburgh at the same time in the same venue:

Decoupage Collective (Lost Game)

Setesdal Collective (The Eternal Kiss, Bursdagsfest)

BetweenTeethTheatre (Perpetual)

Look them up, give them a share or a like!

story:
I Need Your Help! 

I've got a month to nail down the logistics of getting my work onstage. This will be my first play to have a run off-Broadway. It is a dream come true. And also a very short timeline. And you can play a huge role in making this a reality!

  • Donations go towards everyone involved (actors, stage management, etc.) for their work, travel, food, and accommodations, and will also go towards production costs, including props and costumes.
  • The show will run on December 9th (at 9 pm) and December 10th (at 3 pm) at Manhattan Repertory Theatre (17 W 45th St)
  • If this off-Broadway run succeeds, Garbage Person Karaoke plans to head to the DC Fringe Festival in 2017. Donors of a certain level will receive free tickets to a performance!
  • Any gift, even a dollar, will help this passion project come to life in messy, fiery, hilarious ways. I can't believe this is taking off so suddenly. You will literally help a dream come true, and I won't be able to thank you enough.

Just like karaoke, getting this show on the road will be scary, exhilarating, and (probably) enjoyable while hammered. What do you have to lose!

How You Can Help!

  • Any little bit helps! Seriously! Anything from $1 to whatever fits your heart's content will be insanely helpful. And appreciated. And rewarded!
  • Can't give a donation? You can still help! Share this page on the social media page(s) of your choice, and receive a bounty of karma, love, and hugs (both real and virtual!) 
  • Don't like the internet? Tell your friends and loved ones about this through word of mouth! Like they did during pioneer times! I miss those days!

I love you all!

story:
Dear ppl,

My name is Vojislav Arsić and I believe it is important that Amy Winehouse gets a monument in her style. Theatre play “Back to Amy” is her monument in Belgrade, this play is my monument of time.

For me, it is important to speak about Amy, but also it’s important for us to talk about ourselves. Play “Back to Amy” is the play that could also be called “Back to us” and will talk about what Amy Winehouse meant to us. What her music meant for the world and for the growth of music scene, but much more about what did she meant for us, people who lived from her music. Emotionally, not existentially. We want to hear stories of people around the world about how and when Amy and her music appeared on their path, and left a mark on it.

My personal motivation to work on this play is my path, my circle. And closing of the circle. My life was marked by many problems which Amy encountered too, on the other hand, Amy was my escape in times when I encountered myself.

I believe in myself, I believe in my team and I believe in you! I believe that you are able to help us raise this play. I invite all of you to send us your stories on backtoamy@reflektorteatar.rs and according to your capabilities donate the money and help us get more people to hear about us.

I hope to see you on the premiere, in Belgrade, or on the live stream.

Greetings from Belgrade,
Vojislav Arsić

Theatre play “Back to Amy” is a play about songwriter who made the non-commercial music content very popular, conquering the world and all music relevant awards. The play will documentary access the work of an artist through the lens of Belgrade and her last concert, through thinking about capitalism and cruel rules of the entertainment world and through stage review on causes and consequences.

The topic that interests us now is Amy Winehouse: Phenomenon of her popularity as well as the life story of this artist as pop-cultural myth, modern tragedy but also a reason for wider social debate about problems of young people, which leads them to different forms of self-destructive behavior.

Our play about Amy Winehouse is not dramatic and it’s not biographic. This is a documentary, autobiographical expression about why we love her, why do we identify with her songs and a question: Did we learn something from her? 

In this play, nobody plays Amy. Actresses and actors on stage play artistically shaped stories from people around the world, people who were on her last show in Belgrade... Who loves her music and who, for many reasons, were shocked by Amy’s tragic death.

Schedule:
04. July 2017 – Premiere, Belgrade
05. July 2017 – First replay, Belgrade
06. July 2017 – Second replay, Belgrade

After premiere, play will be regularly in the repertoire of Belgrade Youth Center, we’re also expecting a tour around Serbia and region and participations in festivals.

For our supporters we will provide livestream of the premiere on 04. July 2017. from Belgrade.

Our performance is the way to raise a monument to Amy Winehouse. It is also a monument of her creativity, as well as warning to every one of us, that are treating our life and health without respect.

Dealing with our memories and thoughts about Amy, we want to rethink: What is the fatal attraction of self-destruction? What happens when personal problems are treating like sensation? Did Amy’s tragedy have catharsis potential? Can art be created without the pain? Is pain main ingredient of artwork? And finally, why do we love the pain of others?

Is the man the biggest enemy to himself?
Did we love Amy more than she loved herself?
Did we love her exactly because she didn't love herself?
What is the new tragedy, what is tragic in 21th century?
What are we afraid of? Whom do we mourn? Will there be catharsis?

The total value of production of the play "Back to Amy" is $ 38,000, but our plan predicted that the $ 25,000 will be collected through IndieGoGo, and the remaining $ 13,000 will be provided through sponsorships and local donations.

We need your help so that we can make this a reality.
We need YOUR help to make it possible. 

 

-    Over 1500 spectators only on premiere in June
-    Over 30 artists and production members
-    We expect to receive more than 100 different stories from people all over the world
-    20 People In the advisory team, made up of fans of Amy Winehouse in Belgrade
-    Campaign and social network messages include thousands of people around the world
-    About 500 people who will be watching premiere via livestream
-    The show “Back to Amy" will continue to live in Belgrade

1. Contribute with your dollars. Give to the IndieGogo. Match funds from the IndieGogo campaign. Show your support through the donations and watch us via livestream, in case you are not in Belgrade.

2. Recommend us to your friends. Share IndieGoGo link on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram and use hashtag  #backtoamy. You can send emails to your friends and recommend them to help us. Link: https://igg.me/at/back-to-amy 

3. Send us your story about what Amy Winehouse meant to you. Tell us about the moment and situation, that way you will participate in the creation of the documentary part of performance. Contact us at backtoamy@reflektorteatar.rs

4. If you are physically in Belgrade donate your time and skills. If you have knowledge of marketing, financing, corporate social responsibility, the legal aspects of the work of the artist or the fields that are related to those, be our adviser, friend, who will be there and available for developing new ideas and partnerships. If you love theater and young people, support us and their craft (sewing, carpentry, makeup ...) backtoamy@reflektorteatar.rs 

SPOTLIGHT THEATRE is an independent youth theatre production in Belgrade. 

It has been working under the new name since the January of 2017. although it has been on the theatre scene of Serbia and the region since 2012, with productions which goal was to popularize youth, engaged, new and different theatre expression. This expression, born on making equal of the artistic and activist, personal and political, and aestethic and educational, beses itself on the workshop methods and techniques of the process theatre, by which we believe that the process is of equal importance as the product. Focus of our work are young people whith whome we question important topics of society. We believe that theatre is not made of buildings, but people and ideas. Because of that our plays are preformed in different theatres, on different locations. Our plays reflect society and shed light on its darker sides. 

We try to find innovative production solutions, as well as relevant ways to promote our work. We are interested in intensive development of the audience, who we see as an equal member of theatre community. We are also proud on our allies and the possibility to make plays sustainable and make new plays without the long term support of institutions. Our goal is to make our plays and our knowledge available to every young person who is interested in work in arts and culture so we could make a new, young, responsible scene. 

www.reflektorteatar.rs 

SPOTLIGHT THEATRE.
We shine in the dark.
story_txt: Dear ppl,My name is Vojislav Arsić and I believe it is important that Amy Winehouse gets a monument in her style. Theatre play “Back to Amy” is her monument in Belgrade, this play is my monument of time.For me, it is important to speak about Amy, but also it’s important for us to talk about ourselves. Play “Back to Amy” is the play that could also be called “Back to us” and will talk about what Amy Winehouse meant to us. What her music meant for the world and for the growth of music scene, but much more about what did she meant for us, people who lived from her music. Emotionally, not existentially. We want to hear stories of people around the world about how and when Amy and her music appeared on their path, and left a mark on it.My personal motivation to work on this play is my path, my circle. And closing of the circle. My life was marked by many problems which Amy encountered too, on the other hand, Amy was my escape in times when I encountered myself.I believe in myself, I believe in my team and I believe in you! I believe that you are able to help us raise this play. I invite all of you to send us your stories on backtoamy@reflektorteatar.rs and according to your capabilities donate the money and help us get more people to hear about us.I hope to see you on the premiere, in Belgrade, or on the live stream.Greetings from Belgrade,Vojislav ArsićTheatre play “Back to Amy” is a play about songwriter who made the non-commercial music content very popular, conquering the world and all music relevant awards. The play will documentary access the work of an artist through the lens of Belgrade and her last concert, through thinking about capitalism and cruel rules of the entertainment world and through stage review on causes and consequences.The topic that interests us now is Amy Winehouse: Phenomenon of her popularity as well as the life story of this artist as pop-cultural myth, modern tragedy but also a reason for wider social debate about problems of young people, which leads them to different forms of self-destructive behavior.Our play about Amy Winehouse is not dramatic and it’s not biographic. This is a documentary, autobiographical expression about why we love her, why do we identify with her songs and a question: Did we learn something from her? In this play, nobody plays Amy. Actresses and actors on stage play artistically shaped stories from people around the world, people who were on her last show in Belgrade... Who loves her music and who, for many reasons, were shocked by Amy’s tragic death.Schedule:04. July 2017 – Premiere, Belgrade05. July 2017 – First replay, Belgrade06. July 2017 – Second replay, BelgradeAfter premiere, play will be regularly in the repertoire of Belgrade Youth Center, we’re also expecting a tour around Serbia and region and participations in festivals.For our supporters we will provide livestream of the premiere on 04. July 2017. from Belgrade.Our performance is the way to raise a monument to Amy Winehouse. It is also a monument of her creativity, as well as warning to every one of us, that are treating our life and health without respect.Dealing with our memories and thoughts about Amy, we want to rethink: What is the fatal attraction of self-destruction? What happens when personal problems are treating like sensation? Did Amy’s tragedy have catharsis potential? Can art be created without the pain? Is pain main ingredient of artwork? And finally, why do we love the pain of others?Is the man the biggest enemy to himself?Did we love Amy more than she loved herself?Did we love her exactly because she didn't love herself?What is the new tragedy, what is tragic in 21th century?What are we afraid of? Whom do we mourn? Will there be catharsis?The total value of production of the play "Back to Amy" is $ 38,000, but our plan predicted that the $ 25,000 will be collected through IndieGoGo, and the remaining $ 13,000 will be provided through sponsorships and local donations.We need your help so that we can make this a reality.We need YOUR help to make it possible.  -    Over 1500 spectators only on premiere in June-    Over 30 artists and production members-    We expect to receive more than 100 different stories from people all over the world-    20 People In the advisory team, made up of fans of Amy Winehouse in Belgrade-    Campaign and social network messages include thousands of people around the world-    About 500 people who will be watching premiere via livestream-    The show “Back to Amy" will continue to live in Belgrade1. Contribute with your dollars. Give to the IndieGogo. Match funds from the IndieGogo campaign. Show your support through the donations and watch us via livestream, in case you are not in Belgrade.2. Recommend us to your friends. Share IndieGoGo link on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram and use hashtag  #backtoamy. You can send emails to your friends and recommend them to help us. Link: https://igg.me/at/back-to-amy 3. Send us your story about what Amy Winehouse meant to you. Tell us about the moment and situation, that way you will participate in the creation of the documentary part of performance. Contact us at backtoamy@reflektorteatar.rs4. If you are physically in Belgrade donate your time and skills. If you have knowledge of marketing, financing, corporate social responsibility, the legal aspects of the work of the artist or the fields that are related to those, be our adviser, friend, who will be there and available for developing new ideas and partnerships. If you love theater and young people, support us and their craft (sewing, carpentry, makeup ...) backtoamy@reflektorteatar.rs SPOTLIGHT THEATRE is an independent youth theatre production in Belgrade. It has been working under the new name since the January of 2017. although it has been on the theatre scene of Serbia and the region since 2012, with productions which goal was to popularize youth, engaged, new and different theatre expression. This expression, born on making equal of the artistic and activist, personal and political, and aestethic and educational, beses itself on the workshop methods and techniques of the process theatre, by which we believe that the process is of equal importance as the product. Focus of our work are young people whith whome we question important topics of society. We believe that theatre is not made of buildings, but people and ideas. Because of that our plays are preformed in different theatres, on different locations. Our plays reflect society and shed light on its darker sides. We try to find innovative production solutions, as well as relevant ways to promote our work. We are interested in intensive development of the audience, who we see as an equal member of theatre community. We are also proud on our allies and the possibility to make plays sustainable and make new plays without the long term support of institutions. Our goal is to make our plays and our knowledge available to every young person who is interested in work in arts and culture so we could make a new, young, responsible scene. www.reflektorteatar.rs SPOTLIGHT THEATRE.We shine in the dark.

story:
Ruban Production ITP 

(non-porofit organization)

Founded by V.Ruban and team of involved enthusiasts in 2014, Kiev, Ukraine.  
It is the first non-profit dance-production company with a complex approach that specialized in performing arts and contemporary dance. It was found and works for fostering developement and promotion of contemporary dance and performing arts in Ukraine, as well with ukrainian emerging artists globally (in international interdisciplinary and transdisciplinary projects).Since the beginning this evolving initiative is worked and supported by enthusiasts from choreography, institutors, performers, light-designers, support by video-production company, sound-designers, graphic-designers, lawyer, finance-consultants, culture activists, managers etc. 

About the show (performance)

#LetMePleaseYou is an ambitious and one of the largest contemporary dance-productions in Ukraine involving remarkable artists (dance, dance-dramaturgy, performance video-mapping, sound-design and graphic-design) from Ukraine and Lithuania. It will be provocative and extremely specific. In terms of the content it is already rich and complex as it concerns the core of human lifes.

Impressions from creators:

“Monika: What I really liked when working with Viktor and Danil was that they did everything with their own hands. We start all of our work by bringing our own linoleum, laying it out and cleaning the floor. These are the ethics behind their creative work and their perspective. They don’t wait for anything, they go for it and they care” 

 to check full text: article

“V.Ruban: While going deeper with this piece, I see that Soviet builders did a big job in faking the Real. Imposed fake "normal"  family, fake "normal" hapiness, "normal" career, social guaranties and safety if you are well behaving. We 've started from us, we look for soviet things we share  and we deal with them. The project evolves like revealing itself. It's a great opportunity to be part of the process of the society.

Getting to the more pragmatic things - this process of society takes time and  resources to get from intention, idea, inspiration to material shape and has material dimention. The budget of this production looks massive but few facts and figures to know what we need those money for:

production of this piece started in february 2016 and will end in oktober 2016 (9 month); the project team is 19 people that is linked with production during all the period; to be factual total budget of production is 38400$ and consists of costs for logistics (6 810$); technical part (6 090$): at least minimal fee for each involved (14 175$, for all 9 months) and administrative costs (11 340$)

We have benefited support from Lithuanian Culture Institute for at least the part of costs for logistics; I've put all I head from myself too we got already few direct donations indeed. We have great help from hosting us institutions not paying the rent for our stay, work and presentations, some partners giving us hand for free with moments in process but it's still far away from having enough resources to produce the piece.

In Ukraine we still don’t have any institutional financial support and funding for contemporary art. So this fund-raising campaign is the only way to gather resourses to make this production happen. 

We would be very greatful for each coin that you may drop in our potluck." 

 

Want to see it live?

schedule of passed events:

Audition 1 (Kiev, Dovjenko National Center) – confirmed – 15-17th of April 2016

Audition 2 (Kiev, Dovjenko National Center) – confirmed – 20-22nd of May 2016

Residency 1 (Pidghorodtsi, Lviv region, Carpathians) – confirmed – 19-27th of June 2016

schedule of upcoming events:

Residency 2 and 3 (Kiev, Dovjenko National Center) – confirmed – 17-31st of July 2016

Pre-premiere Residency (Nida,Lithuania, CTIC "Agila") – confirmed –

15-25th of September 2016

Premiere (Kiev, ̈House of Officers) – not confirmed – 6-9th of Oktober 2016

 

Our ways of saying “thanks”!

We welcome contributions of any size – big or small, every gift will bring us closer to achieving our goal.  For a gift $25 or more you have the option to receive one of the special perks listed on this page – from personalized shout-outs to exclusive packages that include merch, photos, signed scripts, a personalized video thank-you, an invitation to a studio rehearsal, and even Skype chats with the creators! 
To the most generous contributors there will be also a special perk - personal, 3 days special tour, in Ukraine to experience the premiere in Kiev almost as a part of the team.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

SHARE

Spreading the word is another valuable way you can help us. Share this campaign on Facebook and Twitter. Email it to your friends!
 

#LetMePleaseYou

RUBAN PRODUCTION ITP: Facebook & YouTube

#LETMEPLEASEYOU: Facebook & website & YouTube

 

BECOME A PARTNER

Do you have a business or organization that is interested in pursing unique cultural partnerships through sponsorship contributions? Ruban Production ITP is Ukrainian most respected performing arts innovators, and we'd love to chat with you about additional perks and sponsorship deals available for businesses and organizations.

(give us a shout at ruban.production.itp@gmail.com for more details!)


 
Join the premiere

6-9th of October 2016

in Kiev

story:
Den Of Thieves brings to life the story of recovering addicts looking to change their lives, and get out of destructive patterns.  It plays on stereotypes of addicts and explores their struggles to break free. Thieves is smart, biting, suspenseful, hilarious, fun, and packs one hell of a punch.

"The struggle for self-awareness, self-acceptance, and self-love produce a high-octane battle for survival that's not resolved  until the last donut."

_______________________

Why donate?

  • Have you ever had a dream that you believed in so passionately, that no obstacle would stop you? Well funding is our obstacle! But we REFUSE to let it stop us from telling this story.
  • We believe the underdog deserves a voice!!
  • It is an amazing story because Guirgis KNOWS how to tell a story!!!
  • These characters are relatable: if it's not you, it's your uncle, John. 
  • We are all students and recent graduates fueled by our love for the craft!

  • We already have the space! Stella Adler, Studio 6, 31 W27th Street, NYC.
  • And the dates! September 9th @ 8pm ; September 10th @ 8pm ; September 11th @ 1pm & 6pm.

What we need...

  • $2,500 

Let's break it down...

  • Rehearsal space (NYC is pricey)
  • Costumes
  • Props
  • Lighting
  • Rights for the play
  • Keeping tickets FREE!


Please help us spread the word and please JOIN US for the show! 


Friday, September 9 @ 8pm

Saturday, September 10 @ 8pm

Sunday, September 11 @ 1pm & 6pm . 


Stella Adler Studio 6, 31 W27th Street, NYC

story:
Resumen

 

Medea ha sido un clásico adaptado a la contemporaneidad. Este es un hecho que puede suceder en cualquier lugar de este mundo. Es una historia de amor terminado en tragedia.

Es importante recaudar estos fondos para el estreno de Medea del Olimar de Mariana Percovich, dirigida por Marisol Martínez, Producción General de Hany Rivera en una fusión del Teatro Coreográfico de Caracas y Art-o de Caracas para dar origen a 0 Dramas. Es una fábula que necesita ser presentada.

Los colaboradores contribuirán con el estreno nacional de la obra en Venezuela, para hacer una campaña de promoción que la lleve de gira por diferentes Festivales, presentando este teatro latinoamericano contemporáneo.  El Teatro es el arte que presenta hechos frontales y mantiene una reflexión inmediata ante el espectador.

Necesitamos conseguir fondos para terminar la Producción, fondos para la campaña de promoción y publicidad, que en los actuales momentos, es sumamente cara en Venezuela, mas que en cualquier país de este Universo. Seguir haciendo teatro en un país donde la entrada no llega a 25 centavos de dólares, pero una producción sencilla no baja de unos 250 dólares al cambio (sin promoción y sin publicidad).

 

Hicimos unas presentaciones en el Festival de Teatro de Caracas, hay grandes expectativas con Programadores internacionales, estos casi no cubren pasajes internacionales,...pero debe tener una temporada antes en la Ciudad, con la finalidad de hacer buenas fotografías, vídeos, teaser, ...y eso es un costo altísimo. 

Logrando o no logrando la meta, los fondos son para terminar la producción de Medea del Olimar, con la finalidad de llevar esta fábula lo más lejos posible, con la finalidad de encontrar una reflexión en un tema femenino.

 El teatro sigue siendo más necesario que una guerra o un juego de video Game violento,...no hay comparaciones, pero este discurso teatral presenta una realidad que debe ser comunicada.
 

Esta pieza teatral lleva un drama actual, un discurso importante que debe llevar a una reflexión de cualquier adulto de la sociedad del siglo XXI. 

El Teatro Coreográfico de Caracas y Art-o de Caracas siempre han presentado un discurso actual en su trabajo teatral, un discurso lleno de reflexiones y de actualidad.  

Siempre es un riesgo este discurso femenino, puede ser criticado, pero es importante representarlo.

 

Producir teatro es un riesgo, si es contemporáneo mucho mayor, y presentar esta fábula, puede existir rechazo o puede producir grandes aplausos. 

 No vamos a parar, vamos a seguir haciendo todo lo posible para llevar este mensaje teatral a todas partes donde podamos. Hemos trabajado disciplinadamente y organizadamente, por eso estamos a punto de cumplir la meta.

 

Estamos trabajando diariamente para llegar al 08 de junio con la producción completamente lista. La autora está muy contenta con el trabajo que estamos realizando.  

Necesitamos recaudar 500 dólares para terminar con la producción, poder hacer una larga temporada, cubrir los costos de promoción y con los requisitos internacionales para el Dossier, Videos, Fotografías, envíos. Si usted no puede colaborar, envíe esta campaña a sus amigos por el mundo, siempre hay un dólar por una buena causa, la alimentación espiritual o artística es tan importante como la básica, ayúdenos a mejor y a lograr un proyecto teatral.

Envíen esta campaña por sus redes sociales, a todos sus contactos, y los que puedan colaborar, ayuden para lograr la meta. Muchas gracias anticipadas.

story:
Short Summary

We are Fasmode or Fasa Modern, we are a student run dance team on the Cal State Northridge campus. Being a student run team comes with many complications such as needing to get funding on our own. We are an extremely passionate group of young dancers who are trying to progress and make a change in the dance community while supporting dancers to grow and succeed. We're more than just a dance team, we're a family and we offer a safe and free environment for students to express themselves and have the support they need while going through their college career.  

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise about $10,000 so that our students don't have to worry about one more college fee. Any money goes a long way and will help our team greatly. The $10,000 will go towards getting costumes, paying for competitions (including transportation and hotel), being able to put on our charity showcase and for any equipment we may need for our dancers to succeed. Depending on your donation amount, you will receive gifts from the team (as stated on the perks page).

The Impact

The dance community is one of the fastest growing artistic communities out there. The reason why it's so big is because it offers people of all ages to put their time and energy into something positive. Specifically on a college campuses there's a rising problem in stress and mental illnesses in students. As a dance team we want to be able to create a stress free environment for our students and way for them to "let loose" in a productive manner. We also want to help students in growing as not only dancers, but as leaders as they continue on in their college careers. Instilling confidence and self worth are at the basis of our goals. 

Risks & Challenges

Our challenges reside in the fact that we are a student-run dance team and we don't want our students to have to pay too much. That being said, without the right funds, we cannot function successfully as a dance team because we won't have the means to. Fundraising money is extremely important to us because then that takes one less stressor off of our members. 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are plenty of ways that you can help our team. Helping out with costumes and gear, or donating any dance equipment you may have. Any social connections within the dance community helps a ton. Having a space where we can have practices if our locations ever fall through, or even a possible partnership/sponsorship is greatly appreciated.

The reason why it's so big is because it offers people of all ages to put their time and energy into something positive. Specifically on a college campuses there's a rising problem in stress and mental illnesses in students. As a dance team we want to be able to create a stress free environment for our students and way for them to "let loose" in a productive manner. We also want to help students in growing as not only dancers, but as leaders as they continue on in their college careers. Instilling confidence and self worth are at the basis of our goals. 

Risks & Challenges
Our challenges reside in the fact that we are a student-run dance team and we don't want our students to have to pay too much. That being said, without the right funds, we cannot function successfully as a dance team because we won't have the means to. Fundraising money is extremely important to us because then that takes one less stressor off of our members. 

Other Ways You Can Help
There are plenty of ways that you can help our team. Helping out with costumes and gear, or donating any dance equipment you may have. Any social connections within the dance community helps a ton. Having a space where we can have practices if our locations ever fall through, or even a possible partnership/sponsorship is greatly appreciated.

story:
Pineapple-Shaped Lamps needs your help to raise funds for our upcoming production of Cannibal! The musical, a comedy from the creator of South Park, Team America, and the Tony award winning Book of Mormon.

In the tradition of Friday the 13th Part II and Oklahoma!, comes the first intelligent musical about cannibalism.  Based on the true story of Colorado Cannibal Alferd Packer, telling his version of what really happened when he and a group of gold miners embarked on their fateful trip into the Rocky Mountains. Lost without food, they must turn to the ultimate horror...EATING EACH OTHER...and, of course, SINGING and DANCING! 

Each contribution will bring us one step closer to making "Cannibal! The Musical" the best show possible.

Pineapple-Shaped Lamps is a performance-based production company based in Wilmington, NC. Founded in 2010, its members have made a strong commitment to creating original humorous content including live scripted performances, filmed digital content, short-form improvisation, pantomime shadowcasts, and more. The organization is dedicated to providing a platform for new comedic performers and writers to hone and present their craft for audiences that they otherwise might not have been able to reach.

WINNER: Best Play, Bachelorette, Wilmington Theater Awards 2018
WINNER: Best Comedy Troupe, Encore Magazine's Best of 2018
 

This is our biggest and most ambitious project to date. Our biggest venue, our biggest set, and the biggest amount of budgeting we've ever had to do.  We're confident that we can raise the money in a variety of ways. And a little bit scared too.

But as Babe Ruth wisely said, "Never let the fear of striking out get in your way."

If we don't meet our goal, the show will go on.  The main reason we are asking for the funds is to make this show THE BEST IT CAN BE. One of the worst feelings is seeing a good idea executed badly, so the closer we get to our overall fundraising target, the more we can focus on the quality of the show.

We are asking for $2,500 to make this dream a reality.  That may seem like a lot, but it's only 25% of the total production cost. Musicals are expensive to produce, and this one is no exception. There are costs we have never encountered before: larger space comes with a larger rental fee, costuming a 14-person cast, body microphones, a music director, a band, extra lighting and sound equipment, and so so so much fake blood. 

"What do I get in return?" you might be saying to yourself.  We know that's a lot of money to ask for, and we have varying levels of rewards for your contributions ranging from feel good bragging rights, limited edition Cannibal! The Musical memorabilia, and even a spot on our production team as Executive Producer.

Are you a local business? We are also offering Sponsorship packages!  Email Devin DiMattia at devindimattia@gmail.com for more information on our different sponsorship levels.

Can’t financially contribute?  That’s ok!  Does our story resonate with you?  Great!  Help us get the word out and share our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and that family group chat that’s blowing up your phone.

If you can contribute to our campaign, thank you.  We are so excited about this leap we are making. It's a thrilling and daunting leap, and we know we can do it with your help. 

We are performing at the Hannah Block Historic USO Community Arts Center. 120 S 2nd St, Wilmington, North Carolina 28401

Show dates are October 4th - October 21st.  For more information on tickets, show dates and times, visit our website at www.PSLcomedy.com

story:
INTRODUCTION

I’m happy to announce that we received a grant from the US Embassy in Lisbon and will be returning to The Azores in April of 2020!  I’ll be teaching workshops to the youth for a week followed by a performance of Half-Heard with my amazing company, Rocha Dance Theater! The grant covers our travel and accommodations, but we are still in need of raising funds for all the artist fees. Donate now and help support this incredible project and cultural exchange!

WHO ARE WE?

Hello! I’m Jenny Rocha, choreographer and founder of Rocha Dance Theater. I’m also a performer, costume designer and teaching artist based in Brooklyn, NY. For my current repertoire, Half-Heard, I’m working with company members:  Alex Bittner, Dervla Carey-Jones, Courtney Drasner, Nikki Ervice, Jamie Graham, Nicole Lemelin, as well as composer and husband, Joseph Rivas.

We have all been involved in the creative process for Half-Heard since 2018. Last February, the work was presented and funded, in part, by The CUNY Dance Initiative in partnership with John Jay College/Gerald W. Lynch Theater. Half-Heard premiered to a full house and rave reviews! However, we only got to perform this important work for one night. I knew we needed to share the piece with more audiences and that the performers deserved more opportunities to showcase their hard work, talent and voices.

So I got to work. I received a commission from Roger Williams University to teach, set a work on their students and then perform Half-Heard with RDT. This was part of their Alive Arts Series this past Feb 8th 2020. I also had applied for an Innovation Grant by the US Embassy to teach youth followed by a performance of the piece in The Azores...and got it!

IMPACT

We believe Half-Heard is relevant, relatable and important. The message asks for social change for women in the workplace and beyond. Through imagery and parody, the work is a commentary about equity in the workplace, eliminating micro-aggressions and breaking down stereotypes and gender constructs.

DESCRIPTION OF THE WORK

Integrating dance, theatrical parody and architectural costume design, Half-Heard shows a satirized version of a woman’s struggle to be heard in the workplace. An all-female identifying -- and at times, drag cast -- opens a veritable Pandora's box of the absurdity of gender roles and human behavior.

WHAT ARE WE DOING THERE?

Half-Heard: The Azores Performance & Workshop Series

Rocha Dance Theater will be returning to Sao Miguel, Azores this April. As you may know, my family is from Sao Miguel and I have been developing an artist relationship with the community since RDT’s first Azores residency back in 2018. With the support of a new grant from the US Embassy in Lisbon, I will lead a 5 day workshop for students ages 12-20, teaching repertory and technique. At the end of the week, my company will perform Half-Heard at a local theater called Teatro Ribeiragrandense. The young people will have the opportunity to perform the culminated piece as part of our show, which is free to the community.

WHAT ARE WE ASKING?

Crowdfunding, private donors and fans like you help small dance companies continue to make great work. We hope that you will consider a donation towards RDT’s return to the Azores! We have a large group of 8 people this time so we need some help covering the remainder of the fees. The grant from The US Embassy in Lisbon covers airfare and local transportation. The remaining funds that we need to raise are for all artist fees. In order to reach the minimum budget, we will need to raise an additional $6000. This amount will cover a flat fee for each company member. The company will rehearse in NYC for a two week period and then travel abroad for 4 days where they will participate in tech, dress rehearsals and the performance.

Would you consider supporting Half-Heard: The Azores Performance & Workshop Series by making a contribution? Your support is greatly appreciated and will be used to cultivate a cultural exchange in dance! If you cannot make a donation, can you help spread the word/share the campaign?

PERKS

Check out the cool perks for different donation amounts. We've got:  shout outs, dance videos,  souvenirs, open rehearsals and more! 

BIOS

Jenny Rocha is a choreographer, dancer, costume designer and Artistic Director of Rocha Dance Theater since 2001. She is also the Director of The Painted Ladies, a cabaret group that was admitted into the Burlesque Hall of Fame in Las Vegas. A first generation Portuguese-American from New Bedford, Massachusetts, Rocha attended Roger Williams University for Dance and Performance, where she graduated with an Outstanding Achievement in Dance Award. She then moved to New York City, where Jenny served as a member of Sean Curran Company, Heidi Latsky Dance and other choreographers for 12 collective years.  Her choreography has been presented by esteemed venues such as The Philadelphia Museum of Art, The Boston Center for the Arts, Danspace Project, La MaMa, Galapagos Art Space, and more. Rocha has received awards and residencies including The Puffin Foundation grant, Galapagos Art Space Residency from 2008-2014, Armitage Gone! Dance/MANA Contemporary Space Residency and CUNY Dance Initiative in 2015 and 2018. The US Embassy in Lisbon has awarded her two consecutive Innovation Grants to perform her work in Azores, Portugal, as well as host educational workshops in 2018 ans 2020.  Recently, Jenny also received The Alive Arts Commission from Roger Wiliams University in 2020. Rocha’s choreography has received critical acclaim from The New York Times, The Boston Globe, and The Village Voice, among others. As a teaching artist, she has taught dance at universities and colleges nationwide, including Roger Williams University, Connecticut College, West Virginia University, and Lehman College. Rocha currently teaches choreography at the Brooklyn Academy of Music, since 2012, and serves on the guest faculty of Mark Morris Dance Center.

Artist statement: As an interdisciplinary artist, I enjoy intersecting two of my artistic passions, dance and costume design, to create visual, provocative performances for audiences and communities. How the dancer is moving as well as how the dancer is manipulating costumes, or represented by clothing, is integral to the storytelling aspects of my work.


Joseph Rivas is the founder of Beat Instinct Music, a production studio where he is a music producer, composer and mix engineer.  He works in genres that include Sound for Film, Electronic, Hip hop, Bass and Orchestral.  Joe is a 5 time Indaba Music contest winner including two grand prizes for his original productions in the Com Truise (ghostly international) sample session at Converse Rubber Tracks and the sample session featuring Franki Chan, Heems, Gavin Turek, Pictureplane and Mark Redito fka Spazzkid.  As the music supervisor and composer for Rocha Dance Theater he regularly produces tracks, videos and original scores for the company.  Joe is also a film mixer, sound designer and re-recording engineer. 

Alex Bittner was raised in Brooklyn, New York. She began her training at the Mark Morris Dance Center, and went on to LaGuardia High School of the Performing Arts. She graduated with a BFA from SUNY Purchase, where she performed works by Alexandra Beller, Martha Graham, MADBoots, Jose Limon, and more. She is currently dancing with Corinne Shearer and Dancers, Garrett Parker/Detox Dance, Jody Sperling/Timelapse Dance, and Michiyaya Dance.

Dervla Carey-Jones is from San Francisco, California, and has a Bachelor of Fine Arts from NYU’s Tisch Dance program. While studying abroad in NYU’s dance program in Berlin, Dervla worked with artists including Dominique Duszynski, Meg Stuart, and Johannes Wieland. In addition to working with Rocha Dance Theater, Dervla dances for Cherylyn Lavagnino Dance, is an apprentice with UNA Projects, and continues to freelance.

Courtney Drasner grew up in MN and later received a BFA in dance from NYU. Since graduating, she has been fortunate enough to perform with Donnell Oakley, Max Stone, Gibney Dance, Janessa Clark, the median movement, Erica Essner, and The Painted Ladies, among others. She is thrilled to be working with Rocha Dance Theater again this season.

Nikki Ervice began her dance training in her hometown of Homer, Alaska. She graduated from the University of Minnesota, Twin Cities with a BFA in dance in 2014. Since moving to New York she has worked with Althea Dance Company, Ayako Takahashi's Ayalis in Motion, Emotions Physical Theatre, Jennifer Archibald’s Arch Dance Company and Safety Third Productions among others. She performed in Rocha Dance Theater's BATTLEDRESS in 2017 and is proud to be a part of Half Heard.

Jamie Graham is a performer and improvisor based in NYC. Since 2010 she has performed with Amy Larimer as the one and only dance-theater-improv duo The Raving Jaynes, as well as with Rocha Dance Theater and The Painted Ladies, both under the direction of Jenny Rocha. She recently joined the cast of Third Rail’s immersive dance theater show Then She Fell. Jamie is also a longtime student of Barbara Mahler. She completed a B.F.A. in Dance and B.A. in English Literature at Webster University and one year of post-graduate study at Rotterdamse Dansacademie / CODARTS.

Nicole Lemelin grew up on a horse farm in Central Connecticut and began her dance training at Starship Dance Theater.  She attended SUNY Purchase and graduated Magna Cum Laude with a BFA in Dance Performance.  There she had the opportunity to perform works by Adam Barruch, John Heginbotham, Doug Varone, Rosalind Newman and others.  Nicole has toured internationally to Sri Lanka with Sea Legs Dance and currently resides in NYC dancing with Rocha Dance Theater and several independent artists.  As a dance maker Nicole has presented work at Dixon Place, CHI Movement Arts Center and The Dragons Egg of Connecticut.
